2849 // Setup external matches for syn_regexec().
2850 unref_extmatch(re_extmatch_in);
2851 re_extmatch_in = ref_extmatch(start_ext);
2852
2853 matchcol = startpos->col; // start looking for a match at sstart
2854 start_idx = idx; // remember the first END pattern.
2855 best_regmatch.startpos[0].col = 0; // avoid compiler warning
2856
2857 // use syntax iskeyword option
2858 save_chartab(buf_chartab);
2859
2860 for (;;)
2861 {
2862 /*
2863 * Find end pattern that matches first after "matchcol".
2864 */
2865 best_idx = -1;
2866 for (idx = start_idx; idx < syn_block->b_syn_patterns.ga_len; ++idx)
2867 {
2868 int lc_col = matchcol;
2869 int r;
2870
2871 spp = &(SYN_ITEMS(syn_block)((synpat_T *)((syn_block)->b_syn_patterns.ga_data))[idx]);
2872 if (spp->sp_type != SPTYPE_END3) // past last END pattern
2873 break;
2874 lc_col -= spp->sp_offsets[SPO_LC_OFF6];
2875 if (lc_col < 0)
2876 lc_col = 0;
2877
2878 regmatch.rmm_ic = spp->sp_ic;
2879 regmatch.regprog = spp->sp_prog;
2880 r = syn_regexec(&regmatch, startpos->lnum, lc_col,
2881 IF_SYN_TIME(&spp->sp_time)(&spp->sp_time));
2882 spp->sp_prog = regmatch.regprog;
2883 if (r)
2884 {
2885 if (best_idx == -1 || regmatch.startpos[0].col
2886 < best_regmatch.startpos[0].col)
2887 {
2888 best_idx = idx;
2889 best_regmatch.startpos[0] = regmatch.startpos[0];
2890 best_regmatch.endpos[0] = regmatch.endpos[0];
2891 }
2892 }
2893 }
2894
2895 /*
2896 * If all end patterns have been tried, and there is no match, the
2897 * item continues until end-of-line.
2898 */
2899 if (best_idx == -1)
2900 break;
2901
2902 /*
2903 * If the skip pattern matches before the end pattern,
2904 * continue searching after the skip pattern.
2905 */
2906 if (spp_skip != NULL((void*)0))
2907 {
2908 int lc_col = matchcol - spp_skip->sp_offsets[SPO_LC_OFF6];
2909 int r;
2910
2911 if (lc_col < 0)
2912 lc_col = 0;
2913 regmatch.rmm_ic = spp_skip->sp_ic;
2914 regmatch.regprog = spp_skip->sp_prog;
2915 r = syn_regexec(&regmatch, startpos->lnum, lc_col,
2916 IF_SYN_TIME(&spp_skip->sp_time)(&spp_skip->sp_time));
2917 spp_skip->sp_prog = regmatch.regprog;
2918 if (r && regmatch.startpos[0].col
2919 <= best_regmatch.startpos[0].col)
2920 {
2921 int line_len;
2922
2923 // Add offset to skip pattern match
2924 syn_add_end_off(&pos, &regmatch, spp_skip, SPO_ME_OFF1, 1);
2925
2926 // If the skip pattern goes on to the next line, there is no
2927 // match with an end pattern in this line.
2928 if (pos.lnum > startpos->lnum)
2929 break;
2930
2931 line = ml_get_buf(syn_buf, startpos->lnum, FALSE0);
2932 line_len = (int)STRLEN(line)strlen((char *)(line));
2933
2934 // take care of an empty match or negative offset
2935 if (pos.col <= matchcol)
2936 ++matchcol;
2937 else if (pos.col <= regmatch.endpos[0].col)
2938 matchcol = pos.col;
2939 else
2940 // Be careful not to jump over the NUL at the end-of-line
2941 for (matchcol = regmatch.endpos[0].col;
2942 matchcol < line_len && matchcol < pos.col;
2943 ++matchcol)
2944 ;
2945
2946 // if the skip pattern includes end-of-line, break here
2947 if (matchcol >= line_len)
2948 break;
2949
2950 continue; // start with first end pattern again
2951 }
2952 }
2953
2954 /*
2955 * Match from start pattern to end pattern.
2956 * Correct for match and highlight offset of end pattern.
2957 */
2958 spp = &(SYN_ITEMS(syn_block)((synpat_T *)((syn_block)->b_syn_patterns.ga_data))[best_idx]);
2959 syn_add_end_off(m_endpos, &best_regmatch, spp, SPO_ME_OFF1, 1);
2960 // can't end before the start
2961 if (m_endpos->lnum == startpos->lnum && m_endpos->col < startpos->col)
2962 m_endpos->col = startpos->col;
2963
2964 syn_add_end_off(end_endpos, &best_regmatch, spp, SPO_HE_OFF3, 1);
2965 // can't end before the start
2966 if (end_endpos->lnum == startpos->lnum
2967 && end_endpos->col < startpos->col)
2968 end_endpos->col = startpos->col;
2969 // can't end after the match
2970 limit_pos(end_endpos, m_endpos);
2971
2972 /*
2973 * If the end group is highlighted differently, adjust the pointers.
2974 */
2975 if (spp->sp_syn_match_id != spp->sp_syn.id && spp->sp_syn_match_id != 0)
2976 {
2977 *end_idx = best_idx;
2978 if (spp->sp_off_flags & (1 << (SPO_RE_OFF5 + SPO_COUNT7)))
2979 {
2980 hl_endpos->lnum = best_regmatch.endpos[0].lnum;
2981 hl_endpos->col = best_regmatch.endpos[0].col;
2982 }
2983 else
2984 {
2985 hl_endpos->lnum = best_regmatch.startpos[0].lnum;
2986 hl_endpos->col = best_regmatch.startpos[0].col;
2987 }
2988 hl_endpos->col += spp->sp_offsets[SPO_RE_OFF5];
2989
2990 // can't end before the start
2991 if (hl_endpos->lnum == startpos->lnum
2992 && hl_endpos->col < startpos->col)
2993 hl_endpos->col = startpos->col;
2994 limit_pos(hl_endpos, m_endpos);
2995
2996 // now the match ends where the highlighting ends, it is turned
2997 // into the matchgroup for the end
2998 *m_endpos = *hl_endpos;
2999 }
3000 else
3001 {
3002 *end_idx = 0;
3003 *hl_endpos = *end_endpos;
3004 }
3005
3006 *flagsp = spp->sp_flags;
3007
3008 had_match = TRUE1;
3009 break;
3010 }
3011
3012 // no match for an END pattern in this line
3013 if (!had_match)
3014 m_endpos->lnum = 0;
3015
3016 restore_chartab(buf_chartab);
3017
3018 // Remove external matches.
3019 unref_extmatch(re_extmatch_in);
3020 re_extmatch_in = NULL((void*)0);
3021}
3022
3023/*
3024 * Limit "pos" not to be after "limit".
3025 */
3026 static void
3027limit_pos(lpos_T *pos, lpos_T *limit)
3028{
3029 if (pos->lnum > limit->lnum)
3030 *pos = *limit;
3031 else if (pos->lnum == limit->lnum && pos->col > limit->col)
3032 pos->col = limit->col;
3033}
3034
3035/*
3036 * Limit "pos" not to be after "limit", unless pos->lnum is zero.
3037 */
3038 static void
3039limit_pos_zero(
3040 lpos_T *pos,
3041 lpos_T *limit)
3042{
3043 if (pos->lnum == 0)
3044 *pos = *limit;
3045 else
3046 limit_pos(pos, limit);
3047}
3048
3049/*
3050 * Add offset to matched text for end of match or highlight.
3051 */
3052 static void
3053syn_add_end_off(
3054 lpos_T *result, // returned position
3055 regmmatch_T *regmatch, // start/end of match
3056 synpat_T *spp, // matched pattern
3057 int idx, // index of offset
3058 int extra) // extra chars for offset to start
3059{
3060 int col;
3061 int off;
3062 char_u *base;
3063 char_u *p;
3064
3065 if (spp->sp_off_flags & (1 << idx))
3066 {
3067 result->lnum = regmatch->startpos[0].lnum;
3068 col = regmatch->startpos[0].col;
3069 off = spp->sp_offsets[idx] + extra;
3070 }
3071 else
3072 {
3073 result->lnum = regmatch->endpos[0].lnum;
3074 col = regmatch->endpos[0].col;
3075 off = spp->sp_offsets[idx];
3076 }
3077 // Don't go past the end of the line. Matters for "rs=e+2" when there
3078 // is a matchgroup. Watch out for match with last NL in the buffer.
3079 if (result->lnum > syn_buf->b_ml.ml_line_count)
3080 col = 0;
3081 else if (off != 0)
3082 {
3083 base = ml_get_buf(syn_buf, result->lnum, FALSE0);
3084 p = base + col;
3085 if (off > 0)
3086 {
3087 while (off-- > 0 && *p != NUL'\000')
3088 MB_PTR_ADV(p)p += (*mb_ptr2len)(p);
3089 }
3090 else if (off < 0)
3091 {
3092 while (off++ < 0 && base < p)
3093 MB_PTR_BACK(base, p)p -= has_mbyte ? ((*mb_head_off)(base, p - 1) + 1) : 1;
3094 }
3095 col = (int)(p - base);
3096 }
3097 result->col = col;
3098}
3099
3100/*
3101 * Add offset to matched text for start of match or highlight.
3102 * Avoid resulting column to become negative.
3103 */
3104 static void
3105syn_add_start_off(
3106 lpos_T *result, // returned position
3107 regmmatch_T *regmatch, // start/end of match
3108 synpat_T *spp,
3109 int idx,
3110 int extra) // extra chars for offset to end
3111{
3112 int col;
3113 int off;
3114 char_u *base;
3115 char_u *p;
3116
3117 if (spp->sp_off_flags & (1 << (idx + SPO_COUNT7)))
3118 {
3119 result->lnum = regmatch->endpos[0].lnum;
3120 col = regmatch->endpos[0].col;
3121 off = spp->sp_offsets[idx] + extra;
3122 }
3123 else
3124 {
3125 result->lnum = regmatch->startpos[0].lnum;
3126 col = regmatch->startpos[0].col;
3127 off = spp->sp_offsets[idx];
3128 }
3129 if (result->lnum > syn_buf->b_ml.ml_line_count)
3130 {
3131 // a "\n" at the end of the pattern may take us below the last line
3132 result->lnum = syn_buf->b_ml.ml_line_count;
3133 col = (int)STRLEN(ml_get_buf(syn_buf, result->lnum, FALSE))strlen((char *)(ml_get_buf(syn_buf, result->lnum, 0)));
3134 }
3135 if (off != 0)
3136 {
3137 base = ml_get_buf(syn_buf, result->lnum, FALSE0);
3138 p = base + col;
3139 if (off > 0)
3140 {
3141 while (off-- && *p != NUL'\000')
3142 MB_PTR_ADV(p)p += (*mb_ptr2len)(p);
3143 }
3144 else if (off < 0)
3145 {
3146 while (off++ && base < p)
3147 MB_PTR_BACK(base, p)p -= has_mbyte ? ((*mb_head_off)(base, p - 1) + 1) : 1;
3148 }
3149 col = (int)(p - base);
3150 }
3151 result->col = col;
3152}

3163/*
3164 * Call vim_regexec() to find a match with "rmp" in "syn_buf".
3165 * Returns TRUE when there is a match.
3166 */
3167 static int
3168syn_regexec(
3169 regmmatch_T *rmp,
3170 linenr_T lnum,
3171 colnr_T col,
3172 syn_time_T *st UNUSED__attribute__((unused)))
3173{
3174 int r;
3175#ifdef FEAT_RELTIME
3176 int timed_out = FALSE0;
3177#endif
3178#ifdef FEAT_PROFILE
3179 proftime_T pt;
3180
3181 if (syn_time_on)
3182 profile_start(&pt);
3183#endif
3184
3185 if (rmp->regprog == NULL((void*)0))
3186 // This can happen if a previous call to vim_regexec_multi() tried to
3187 // use the NFA engine, which resulted in NFA_TOO_EXPENSIVE, and
3188 // compiling the pattern with the other engine fails.
3189 return FALSE0;
3190
3191 rmp->rmm_maxcol = syn_buf->b_p_smc;
3192 r = vim_regexec_multi(rmp, syn_win, syn_buf, lnum, col,
3193#ifdef FEAT_RELTIME
3194 syn_tm, &timed_out
3195#else
3196 NULL((void*)0), NULL((void*)0)
3197#endif
3198 );
3199
3200#ifdef FEAT_PROFILE
3201 if (syn_time_on)
3202 {
3203 profile_end(&pt);
3204 profile_add(&st->total, &pt);
3205 if (profile_cmp(&pt, &st->slowest) < 0)
3206 st->slowest = pt;
3207 ++st->count;
3208 if (r > 0)
3209 ++st->match;
3210 }
3211#endif
3212#ifdef FEAT_RELTIME
3213 if (timed_out && !syn_win->w_s->b_syn_slow)
3214 {
3215 syn_win->w_s->b_syn_slow = TRUE1;
3216 msg(_("'redrawtime' exceeded, syntax highlighting disabled")dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)("'redrawtime' exceeded, syntax highlighting disabled"
), 5));
3217 }
3218#endif
3219
3220 if (r > 0)
3221 {
3222 rmp->startpos[0].lnum += lnum;
3223 rmp->endpos[0].lnum += lnum;
3224 return TRUE1;
3225 }
3226 return FALSE0;
3227}

3229/*
3230 * Check one position in a line for a matching keyword.
3231 * The caller must check if a keyword can start at startcol.
3232 * Return its ID if found, 0 otherwise.
3233 */
3234 static int
3235check_keyword_id(
3236 char_u *line,
3237 int startcol, // position in line to check for keyword
3238 int *endcolp, // return: character after found keyword
3239 long *flagsp, // return: flags of matching keyword
3240 short **next_listp, // return: next_list of matching keyword
3241 stateitem_T *cur_si, // item at the top of the stack
3242 int *ccharp UNUSED__attribute__((unused))) // conceal substitution char
3243{
3244 keyentry_T *kp;
3245 char_u *kwp;
3246 int round;
3247 int kwlen;
3248 char_u keyword[MAXKEYWLEN80 + 1]; // assume max. keyword len is 80
3249 hashtab_T *ht;
3250 hashitem_T *hi;
3251
3252 // Find first character after the keyword. First character was already
3253 // checked.
3254 kwp = line + startcol;
3255 kwlen = 0;
3256 do
3257 {
3258 if (has_mbyte)
3259 kwlen += (*mb_ptr2len)(kwp + kwlen);
3260 else
3261 ++kwlen;
3262 }
3263 while (vim_iswordp_buf(kwp + kwlen, syn_buf));
3264
3265 if (kwlen > MAXKEYWLEN80)
3266 return 0;
3267
3268 /*
3269 * Must make a copy of the keyword, so we can add a NUL and make it
3270 * lowercase.
3271 */
3272 vim_strncpy(keyword, kwp, kwlen);
3273
3274 /*
3275 * Try twice:
3276 * 1. matching case
3277 * 2. ignoring case
3278 */
3279 for (round = 1; round <= 2; ++round)
3280 {
3281 ht = round == 1 ? &syn_block->b_keywtab : &syn_block->b_keywtab_ic;
3282 if (ht->ht_used == 0)
3283 continue;
3284 if (round == 2) // ignore case
3285 (void)str_foldcase(kwp, kwlen, keyword, MAXKEYWLEN80 + 1);
3286
3287 /*
3288 * Find keywords that match. There can be several with different
3289 * attributes.
3290 * When current_next_list is non-zero accept only that group, otherwise:
3291 * Accept a not-contained keyword at toplevel.
3292 * Accept a keyword at other levels only if it is in the contains list.
3293 */
3294 hi = hash_find(ht, keyword);
3295 if (!HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == &hash_removed
))
3296 for (kp = HI2KE(hi)((keyentry_T *)(((hi)->hi_key) - (dumkey.keyword - (char_u
*)&dumkey))); kp != NULL((void*)0); kp = kp->ke_next)
3297 {
3298 if (current_next_list != 0
3299 ? in_id_list(NULL((void*)0), current_next_list, &kp->k_syn, 0)
3300 : (cur_si == NULL((void*)0)
3301 ? !(kp->flags & HL_CONTAINED0x01)
3302 : in_id_list(cur_si, cur_si->si_cont_list,
3303 &kp->k_syn, kp->flags & HL_CONTAINED0x01)))
3304 {
3305 *endcolp = startcol + kwlen;
3306 *flagsp = kp->flags;
3307 *next_listp = kp->next_list;
3308#ifdef FEAT_CONCEAL
3309 *ccharp = kp->k_char;
3310#endif
3311 return kp->k_syn.id;
3312 }
3313 }
3314 }
3315 return 0;
3316}

3510/*
3511 * Clear all syntax info for one buffer.
3512 */
3513 void
3514syntax_clear(synblock_T *block)
3515{
3516 int i;
3517
3518 block->b_syn_error = FALSE0; // clear previous error
3519#ifdef FEAT_RELTIME
3520 block->b_syn_slow = FALSE0; // clear previous timeout
3521#endif
3522 block->b_syn_ic = FALSE0; // Use case, by default
3523 block->b_syn_foldlevel = SYNFLD_START0;
3524 block->b_syn_spell = SYNSPL_DEFAULT0; // default spell checking
3525 block->b_syn_containedin = FALSE0;
3526#ifdef FEAT_CONCEAL
3527 block->b_syn_conceal = FALSE0;
3528#endif
3529
3530 // free the keywords
3531 clear_keywtab(&block->b_keywtab);
3532 clear_keywtab(&block->b_keywtab_ic);
3533
3534 // free the syntax patterns
3535 for (i = block->b_syn_patterns.ga_len; --i >= 0; )
3536 syn_clear_pattern(block, i);
3537 ga_clear(&block->b_syn_patterns);
3538
3539 // free the syntax clusters
3540 for (i = block->b_syn_clusters.ga_len; --i >= 0; )
3541 syn_clear_cluster(block, i);
3542 ga_clear(&block->b_syn_clusters);
3543 block->b_spell_cluster_id = 0;
3544 block->b_nospell_cluster_id = 0;
3545
3546 block->b_syn_sync_flags = 0;
3547 block->b_syn_sync_minlines = 0;
3548 block->b_syn_sync_maxlines = 0;
3549 block->b_syn_sync_linebreaks = 0;
3550
3551 vim_regfree(block->b_syn_linecont_prog);
3552 block->b_syn_linecont_prog = NULL((void*)0);
3553 VIM_CLEAR(block->b_syn_linecont_pat)do { if ((block->b_syn_linecont_pat) != ((void*)0)) { vim_free
(block->b_syn_linecont_pat); (block->b_syn_linecont_pat
) = ((void*)0); } } while (0);
3554#ifdef FEAT_FOLDING
3555 block->b_syn_folditems = 0;
3556#endif
3557 clear_string_option(&block->b_syn_isk);
3558
3559 // free the stored states
3560 syn_stack_free_all(block);
3561 invalidate_current_state();
3562
3563 // Reset the counter for ":syn include"
3564 running_syn_inc_tag = 0;
3565}
3566
3567/*
3568 * Get rid of ownsyntax for window "wp".
3569 */
3570 void
3571reset_synblock(win_T *wp)
3572{
3573 if (wp->w_s != &wp->w_buffer->b_s)
3574 {
3575 syntax_clear(wp->w_s);
3576 vim_free(wp->w_s);
3577 wp->w_s = &wp->w_buffer->b_s;
3578 }
3579}
3580
3581/*
3582 * Clear syncing info for one buffer.
3583 */
3584 static void
3585syntax_sync_clear(void)
3586{
3587 int i;
3588
3589 // free the syntax patterns
3590 for (i = curwin->w_s->b_syn_patterns.ga_len; --i >= 0; )
3591 if (SYN_ITEMS(curwin->w_s)((synpat_T *)((curwin->w_s)->b_syn_patterns.ga_data))[i].sp_syncing)
3592 syn_remove_pattern(curwin->w_s, i);
3593
3594 curwin->w_s->b_syn_sync_flags = 0;
3595 curwin->w_s->b_syn_sync_minlines = 0;
3596 curwin->w_s->b_syn_sync_maxlines = 0;
3597 curwin->w_s->b_syn_sync_linebreaks = 0;
3598
3599 vim_regfree(curwin->w_s->b_syn_linecont_prog);
3600 curwin->w_s->b_syn_linecont_prog = NULL((void*)0);
3601 VIM_CLEAR(curwin->w_s->b_syn_linecont_pat)do { if ((curwin->w_s->b_syn_linecont_pat) != ((void*)0
)) { vim_free(curwin->w_s->b_syn_linecont_pat); (curwin
->w_s->b_syn_linecont_pat) = ((void*)0); } } while (0);
3602 clear_string_option(&curwin->w_s->b_syn_isk);
3603
3604 syn_stack_free_all(curwin->w_s); // Need to recompute all syntax.
3605}
3606
3607/*
3608 * Remove one pattern from the buffer's pattern list.
3609 */
3610 static void
3611syn_remove_pattern(
3612 synblock_T *block,
3613 int idx)
3614{
3615 synpat_T *spp;
3616
3617 spp = &(SYN_ITEMS(block)((synpat_T *)((block)->b_syn_patterns.ga_data))[idx]);
3618#ifdef FEAT_FOLDING
3619 if (spp->sp_flags & HL_FOLD0x2000)
3620 --block->b_syn_folditems;
3621#endif
3622 syn_clear_pattern(block, idx);
3623 mch_memmove(spp, spp + 1,memmove((char *)(spp), (char *)(spp + 1), sizeof(synpat_T) * (
block->b_syn_patterns.ga_len - idx - 1))
3624 sizeof(synpat_T) * (block->b_syn_patterns.ga_len - idx - 1))memmove((char *)(spp), (char *)(spp + 1), sizeof(synpat_T) * (
block->b_syn_patterns.ga_len - idx - 1));
3625 --block->b_syn_patterns.ga_len;
3626}
3627
3628/*
3629 * Clear and free one syntax pattern. When clearing all, must be called from
3630 * last to first!
3631 */
3632 static void
3633syn_clear_pattern(synblock_T *block, int i)
3634{
3635 vim_free(SYN_ITEMS(block)((synpat_T *)((block)->b_syn_patterns.ga_data))[i].sp_pattern);
3636 vim_regfree(SYN_ITEMS(block)((synpat_T *)((block)->b_syn_patterns.ga_data))[i].sp_prog);
3637 // Only free sp_cont_list and sp_next_list of first start pattern
3638 if (i == 0 || SYN_ITEMS(block)((synpat_T *)((block)->b_syn_patterns.ga_data))[i - 1].sp_type != SPTYPE_START2)
3639 {
3640 vim_free(SYN_ITEMS(block)((synpat_T *)((block)->b_syn_patterns.ga_data))[i].sp_cont_list);
3641 vim_free(SYN_ITEMS(block)((synpat_T *)((block)->b_syn_patterns.ga_data))[i].sp_next_list);
3642 vim_free(SYN_ITEMS(block)((synpat_T *)((block)->b_syn_patterns.ga_data))[i].sp_syn.cont_in_list);
3643 }
3644}
3645
3646/*
3647 * Clear and free one syntax cluster.
3648 */
3649 static void
3650syn_clear_cluster(synblock_T *block, int i)
3651{
3652 vim_free(SYN_CLSTR(block)((syn_cluster_T *)((block)->b_syn_clusters.ga_data))[i].scl_name);
3653 vim_free(SYN_CLSTR(block)((syn_cluster_T *)((block)->b_syn_clusters.ga_data))[i].scl_name_u);
3654 vim_free(SYN_CLSTR(block)((syn_cluster_T *)((block)->b_syn_clusters.ga_data))[i].scl_list);
3655}
3656
3657/*
3658 * Handle ":syntax clear" command.
3659 */
3660 static void
3661syn_cmd_clear(exarg_T *eap, int syncing)
3662{
3663 char_u *arg = eap->arg;
3664 char_u *arg_end;
3665 int id;
3666
3667 eap->nextcmd = find_nextcmd(arg);
3668 if (eap->skip)
3669 return;
3670
3671 /*
3672 * We have to disable this within ":syn include @group filename",
3673 * because otherwise @group would get deleted.
3674 * Only required for Vim 5.x syntax files, 6.0 ones don't contain ":syn
3675 * clear".
3676 */
3677 if (curwin->w_s->b_syn_topgrp != 0)
3678 return;
3679
3680 if (ends_excmd2(eap->cmd, arg))
3681 {
3682 /*
3683 * No argument: Clear all syntax items.
3684 */
3685 if (syncing)
3686 syntax_sync_clear();
3687 else
3688 {
3689 syntax_clear(curwin->w_s);
3690 if (curwin->w_s == &curwin->w_buffer->b_s)
3691 do_unlet((char_u *)"b:current_syntax", TRUE1);
3692 do_unlet((char_u *)"w:current_syntax", TRUE1);
3693 }
3694 }
3695 else
3696 {
3697 /*
3698 * Clear the group IDs that are in the argument.
3699 */
3700 while (!ends_excmd2(eap->cmd, arg))
3701 {
3702 arg_end = skiptowhite(arg);
3703 if (*arg == '@')
3704 {
3705 id = syn_scl_namen2id(arg + 1, (int)(arg_end - arg - 1));
3706 if (id == 0)
3707 {
3708 semsg(_("E391: No such syntax cluster: %s")dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)("E391: No such syntax cluster: %s"
), 5), arg);
3709 break;
3710 }
3711 else
3712 {
3713 /*
3714 * We can't physically delete a cluster without changing
3715 * the IDs of other clusters, so we do the next best thing
3716 * and make it empty.
3717 */
3718 short scl_id = id - SYNID_CLUSTER23000;
3719
3720 VIM_CLEAR(SYN_CLSTR(curwin->w_s)[scl_id].scl_list)do { if ((((syn_cluster_T *)((curwin->w_s)->b_syn_clusters
.ga_data))[scl_id].scl_list) != ((void*)0)) { vim_free(((syn_cluster_T
*)((curwin->w_s)->b_syn_clusters.ga_data))[scl_id].scl_list
); (((syn_cluster_T *)((curwin->w_s)->b_syn_clusters.ga_data
))[scl_id].scl_list) = ((void*)0); } } while (0);
3721 }
3722 }
3723 else
3724 {
3725 id = syn_namen2id(arg, (int)(arg_end - arg));
3726 if (id == 0)
3727 {
3728 semsg(_(e_nogroup)dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)(e_nogroup), 5), arg);
3729 break;
3730 }
3731 else
3732 syn_clear_one(id, syncing);
3733 }
3734 arg = skipwhite(arg_end);
3735 }
3736 }
3737 redraw_curbuf_later(SOME_VALID35);
3738 syn_stack_free_all(curwin->w_s); // Need to recompute all syntax.
3739}
3740
3741/*
3742 * Clear one syntax group for the current buffer.
3743 */
3744 static void
3745syn_clear_one(int id, int syncing)
3746{
3747 synpat_T *spp;
3748 int idx;
3749
3750 // Clear keywords only when not ":syn sync clear group-name"
3751 if (!syncing)
3752 {
3753 (void)syn_clear_keyword(id, &curwin->w_s->b_keywtab);
3754 (void)syn_clear_keyword(id, &curwin->w_s->b_keywtab_ic);
3755 }
3756
3757 // clear the patterns for "id"
3758 for (idx = curwin->w_s->b_syn_patterns.ga_len; --idx >= 0; )
3759 {
3760 spp = &(SYN_ITEMS(curwin->w_s)((synpat_T *)((curwin->w_s)->b_syn_patterns.ga_data))[idx]);
3761 if (spp->sp_syn.id != id || spp->sp_syncing != syncing)
3762 continue;
3763 syn_remove_pattern(curwin->w_s, idx);
3764 }
3765}

3773 syn_cmd_onoff(eap, "syntax");

3777 * Handle ":syntax enable" command.
3778 */
3779 static void
3780syn_cmd_enable(exarg_T *eap, int syncing UNUSED__attribute__((unused)))
3781{
3782 set_internal_string_var((char_u *)"syntax_cmd", (char_u *)"enable");
3783 syn_cmd_onoff(eap, "syntax");
3784 do_unlet((char_u *)"g:syntax_cmd", TRUE1);
3785}
3786
3787/*
3788 * Handle ":syntax reset" command.
3789 * It actually resets highlighting, not syntax.
3790 */
3791 static void
3792syn_cmd_reset(exarg_T *eap, int syncing UNUSED__attribute__((unused)))
3793{
3794 eap->nextcmd = check_nextcmd(eap->arg);
3795 if (!eap->skip)
3796 {
3797 set_internal_string_var((char_u *)"syntax_cmd", (char_u *)"reset");
3798 do_cmdline_cmd((char_u *)"runtime! syntax/syncolor.vim");
3799 do_unlet((char_u *)"g:syntax_cmd", TRUE1);
3800 }
3801}

3821 static void
3822syn_cmd_onoff(exarg_T *eap, char *name)
3823{
3824 char_u buf[100];
3825
3826 eap->nextcmd = check_nextcmd(eap->arg);
3827 if (!eap->skip)
3828 {
3829 STRCPY(buf, "so ")strcpy((char *)(buf), (char *)("so "));
3830 vim_snprintf((char *)buf + 3, sizeof(buf) - 3, SYNTAX_FNAME"$VIMRUNTIME/syntax/%s.vim", name);
3831 do_cmdline_cmd(buf);
3832 }
3833}
3834
3835/*
3836 * Handle ":syntax [list]" command: list current syntax words.
3837 */
3838 static void
3839syn_cmd_list(
3840 exarg_T *eap,
3841 int syncing) // when TRUE: list syncing items
3842{
3843 char_u *arg = eap->arg;
3844 int id;
3845 char_u *arg_end;
3846
3847 eap->nextcmd = find_nextcmd(arg);
3848 if (eap->skip)
3849 return;
3850
3851 if (!syntax_present(curwin))
3852 {
3853 msg(_(msg_no_items)dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)(msg_no_items), 5));
3854 return;
3855 }
3856
3857 if (syncing)
3858 {
3859 if (curwin->w_s->b_syn_sync_flags & SF_CCOMMENT0x01)
3860 {
3861 msg_puts(_("syncing on C-style comments")dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)("syncing on C-style comments"
), 5));
3862 syn_lines_msg();
3863 syn_match_msg();
3864 return;
3865 }
3866 else if (!(curwin->w_s->b_syn_sync_flags & SF_MATCH0x02))
3867 {
3868 if (curwin->w_s->b_syn_sync_minlines == 0)
3869 msg_puts(_("no syncing")dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)("no syncing"), 5));
3870 else
3871 {
3872 if (curwin->w_s->b_syn_sync_minlines == MAXLNUM9223372036854775807L)
3873 msg_puts(_("syncing starts at the first line")dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)("syncing starts at the first line"
), 5));
3874 else
3875 {
3876 msg_puts(_("syncing starts ")dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)("syncing starts "), 5));
3877 msg_outnum(curwin->w_s->b_syn_sync_minlines);
3878 msg_puts(_(" lines before top line")dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)(" lines before top line"), 5));
3879 }
3880 syn_match_msg();
3881 }
3882 return;
3883 }
3884 msg_puts_title(_("\n--- Syntax sync items ---")dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)("\n--- Syntax sync items ---"
), 5));
3885 if (curwin->w_s->b_syn_sync_minlines > 0
3886 || curwin->w_s->b_syn_sync_maxlines > 0
3887 || curwin->w_s->b_syn_sync_linebreaks > 0)
3888 {
3889 msg_puts(_("\nsyncing on items")dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)("\nsyncing on items"), 5));
3890 syn_lines_msg();
3891 syn_match_msg();
3892 }
3893 }
3894 else
3895 msg_puts_title(_("\n--- Syntax items ---")dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)("\n--- Syntax items ---"), 5));
3896 if (ends_excmd2(eap->cmd, arg))
3897 {
3898 /*
3899 * No argument: List all group IDs and all syntax clusters.
3900 */
3901 for (id = 1; id <= highlight_num_groups() && !got_int; ++id)
3902 syn_list_one(id, syncing, FALSE0);
3903 for (id = 0; id < curwin->w_s->b_syn_clusters.ga_len && !got_int; ++id)
3904 syn_list_cluster(id);
3905 }
3906 else
3907 {
3908 /*
3909 * List the group IDs and syntax clusters that are in the argument.
3910 */
3911 while (!ends_excmd2(eap->cmd, arg) && !got_int)
3912 {
3913 arg_end = skiptowhite(arg);
3914 if (*arg == '@')
3915 {
3916 id = syn_scl_namen2id(arg + 1, (int)(arg_end - arg - 1));
3917 if (id == 0)
3918 semsg(_("E392: No such syntax cluster: %s")dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)("E392: No such syntax cluster: %s"
), 5), arg);
3919 else
3920 syn_list_cluster(id - SYNID_CLUSTER23000);
3921 }
3922 else
3923 {
3924 id = syn_namen2id(arg, (int)(arg_end - arg));
3925 if (id == 0)
3926 semsg(_(e_nogroup)dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)(e_nogroup), 5), arg);
3927 else
3928 syn_list_one(id, syncing, TRUE1);
3929 }
3930 arg = skipwhite(arg_end);
3931 }
3932 }
3933 eap->nextcmd = check_nextcmd(arg);
3934}
3935
3936 static void
3937syn_lines_msg(void)
3938{
3939 if (curwin->w_s->b_syn_sync_maxlines > 0
3940 || curwin->w_s->b_syn_sync_minlines > 0)
3941 {
3942 msg_puts("; ");
3943 if (curwin->w_s->b_syn_sync_minlines == MAXLNUM9223372036854775807L)
3944 msg_puts(_("from the first line")dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)("from the first line"), 5));
3945 else
3946 {
3947 if (curwin->w_s->b_syn_sync_minlines > 0)
3948 {
3949 msg_puts(_("minimal ")dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)("minimal "), 5));
3950 msg_outnum(curwin->w_s->b_syn_sync_minlines);
3951 if (curwin->w_s->b_syn_sync_maxlines)
3952 msg_puts(", ");
3953 }
3954 if (curwin->w_s->b_syn_sync_maxlines > 0)
3955 {
3956 msg_puts(_("maximal ")dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)("maximal "), 5));
3957 msg_outnum(curwin->w_s->b_syn_sync_maxlines);
3958 }
3959 msg_puts(_(" lines before top line")dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)(" lines before top line"), 5));
3960 }
3961 }
3962}
3963
3964 static void
3965syn_match_msg(void)
3966{
3967 if (curwin->w_s->b_syn_sync_linebreaks > 0)
3968 {
3969 msg_puts(_("; match ")dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)("; match "), 5));
3970 msg_outnum(curwin->w_s->b_syn_sync_linebreaks);
3971 msg_puts(_(" line breaks")dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)(" line breaks"), 5));
3972 }
3973}

3975static int last_matchgroup;
3976
3977struct name_list
3978{
3979 int flag;
3980 char *name;
3981};
3982
3983static void syn_list_flags(struct name_list *nl, int flags, int attr);
3984
3985/*
3986 * List one syntax item, for ":syntax" or "syntax list syntax_name".
3987 */
3988 static void
3989syn_list_one(
3990 int id,
3991 int syncing, // when TRUE: list syncing items
3992 int link_only) // when TRUE; list link-only too
3993{
3994 int attr;
3995 int idx;
3996 int did_header = FALSE0;
3997 synpat_T *spp;
3998 static struct name_list namelist1[] =
3999 {
4000 {HL_DISPLAY0x1000, "display"},
4001 {HL_CONTAINED0x01, "contained"},
4002 {HL_ONELINE0x04, "oneline"},
4003 {HL_KEEPEND0x400, "keepend"},
4004 {HL_EXTEND0x4000, "extend"},
4005 {HL_EXCLUDENL0x800, "excludenl"},
4006 {HL_TRANSP0x02, "transparent"},
4007 {HL_FOLD0x2000, "fold"},
4008#ifdef FEAT_CONCEAL
4009 {HL_CONCEAL0x20000, "conceal"},
4010 {HL_CONCEALENDS0x40000, "concealends"},
4011#endif
4012 {0, NULL((void*)0)}
4013 };
4014 static struct name_list namelist2[] =
4015 {
4016 {HL_SKIPWHITE0x100, "skipwhite"},
4017 {HL_SKIPNL0x80, "skipnl"},
4018 {HL_SKIPEMPTY0x200, "skipempty"},
4019 {0, NULL((void*)0)}
4020 };
4021
4022 attr = HL_ATTR(HLF_D)highlight_attr[(int)(HLF_D)]; // highlight like directories
4023
4024 // list the keywords for "id"
4025 if (!syncing)
4026 {
4027 did_header = syn_list_keywords(id, &curwin->w_s->b_keywtab, FALSE0, attr);
4028 did_header = syn_list_keywords(id, &curwin->w_s->b_keywtab_ic,
4029 did_header, attr);
4030 }
4031
4032 // list the patterns for "id"
4033 for (idx = 0; idx < curwin->w_s->b_syn_patterns.ga_len && !got_int; ++idx)
4034 {
4035 spp = &(SYN_ITEMS(curwin->w_s)((synpat_T *)((curwin->w_s)->b_syn_patterns.ga_data))[idx]);
4036 if (spp->sp_syn.id != id || spp->sp_syncing != syncing)
4037 continue;
4038
4039 (void)syn_list_header(did_header, 999, id);
4040 did_header = TRUE1;
4041 last_matchgroup = 0;
4042 if (spp->sp_type == SPTYPE_MATCH1)
4043 {
4044 put_pattern("match", ' ', spp, attr);
4045 msg_putchar(' ');
4046 }
4047 else if (spp->sp_type == SPTYPE_START2)
4048 {
4049 while (SYN_ITEMS(curwin->w_s)((synpat_T *)((curwin->w_s)->b_syn_patterns.ga_data))[idx].sp_type == SPTYPE_START2)
4050 put_pattern("start", '=', &SYN_ITEMS(curwin->w_s)((synpat_T *)((curwin->w_s)->b_syn_patterns.ga_data))[idx++], attr);
4051 if (SYN_ITEMS(curwin->w_s)((synpat_T *)((curwin->w_s)->b_syn_patterns.ga_data))[idx].sp_type == SPTYPE_SKIP4)
4052 put_pattern("skip", '=', &SYN_ITEMS(curwin->w_s)((synpat_T *)((curwin->w_s)->b_syn_patterns.ga_data))[idx++], attr);
4053 while (idx < curwin->w_s->b_syn_patterns.ga_len
4054 && SYN_ITEMS(curwin->w_s)((synpat_T *)((curwin->w_s)->b_syn_patterns.ga_data))[idx].sp_type == SPTYPE_END3)
4055 put_pattern("end", '=', &SYN_ITEMS(curwin->w_s)((synpat_T *)((curwin->w_s)->b_syn_patterns.ga_data))[idx++], attr);
4056 --idx;
4057 msg_putchar(' ');
4058 }
4059 syn_list_flags(namelist1, spp->sp_flags, attr);
4060
4061 if (spp->sp_cont_list != NULL((void*)0))
4062 put_id_list((char_u *)"contains", spp->sp_cont_list, attr);
4063
4064 if (spp->sp_syn.cont_in_list != NULL((void*)0))
4065 put_id_list((char_u *)"containedin",
4066 spp->sp_syn.cont_in_list, attr);
4067
4068 if (spp->sp_next_list != NULL((void*)0))
4069 {
4070 put_id_list((char_u *)"nextgroup", spp->sp_next_list, attr);
4071 syn_list_flags(namelist2, spp->sp_flags, attr);
4072 }
4073 if (spp->sp_flags & (HL_SYNC_HERE0x10|HL_SYNC_THERE0x20))
4074 {
4075 if (spp->sp_flags & HL_SYNC_HERE0x10)
4076 msg_puts_attr("grouphere", attr);
4077 else
4078 msg_puts_attr("groupthere", attr);
4079 msg_putchar(' ');
4080 if (spp->sp_sync_idx >= 0)
4081 msg_outtrans(highlight_group_name(SYN_ITEMS(curwin->w_s)((synpat_T *)((curwin->w_s)->b_syn_patterns.ga_data))
4082 [spp->sp_sync_idx].sp_syn.id - 1));
4083 else
4084 msg_puts("NONE");
4085 msg_putchar(' ');
4086 }
4087 }
4088
4089 // list the link, if there is one
4090 if (highlight_link_id(id - 1) && (did_header || link_only) && !got_int)
4091 {
4092 (void)syn_list_header(did_header, 999, id);
4093 msg_puts_attr("links to", attr);
4094 msg_putchar(' ');
4095 msg_outtrans(highlight_group_name(highlight_link_id(id - 1) - 1));
4096 }
4097}
4098
4099 static void
4100syn_list_flags(struct name_list *nlist, int flags, int attr)
4101{
4102 int i;
4103
4104 for (i = 0; nlist[i].flag != 0; ++i)
4105 if (flags & nlist[i].flag)
4106 {
4107 msg_puts_attr(nlist[i].name, attr);
4108 msg_putchar(' ');
4109 }
4110}
4111
4112/*
4113 * List one syntax cluster, for ":syntax" or "syntax list syntax_name".
4114 */
4115 static void
4116syn_list_cluster(int id)
4117{
4118 int endcol = 15;
4119
4120 // slight hack: roughly duplicate the guts of syn_list_header()
4121 msg_putchar('\n');
4122 msg_outtrans(SYN_CLSTR(curwin->w_s)((syn_cluster_T *)((curwin->w_s)->b_syn_clusters.ga_data
))[id].scl_name);
4123
4124 if (msg_col >= endcol) // output at least one space
4125 endcol = msg_col + 1;
4126 if (Columns <= endcol) // avoid hang for tiny window
4127 endcol = Columns - 1;
4128
4129 msg_advance(endcol);
4130 if (SYN_CLSTR(curwin->w_s)((syn_cluster_T *)((curwin->w_s)->b_syn_clusters.ga_data
))[id].scl_list != NULL((void*)0))
4131 {
4132 put_id_list((char_u *)"cluster", SYN_CLSTR(curwin->w_s)((syn_cluster_T *)((curwin->w_s)->b_syn_clusters.ga_data
))[id].scl_list,
4133 HL_ATTR(HLF_D)highlight_attr[(int)(HLF_D)]);
4134 }
4135 else
4136 {
4137 msg_puts_attr("cluster", HL_ATTR(HLF_D)highlight_attr[(int)(HLF_D)]);
4138 msg_puts("=NONE");
4139 }
4140}
4141
4142 static void
4143put_id_list(char_u *name, short *list, int attr)
4144{
4145 short *p;
4146
4147 msg_puts_attr((char *)name, attr);
4148 msg_putchar('=');
4149 for (p = list; *p; ++p)
4150 {
4151 if (*p >= SYNID_ALLBUT20000 && *p < SYNID_TOP21000)
4152 {
4153 if (p[1])
4154 msg_puts("ALLBUT");
4155 else
4156 msg_puts("ALL");
4157 }
4158 else if (*p >= SYNID_TOP21000 && *p < SYNID_CONTAINED22000)
4159 {
4160 msg_puts("TOP");
4161 }
4162 else if (*p >= SYNID_CONTAINED22000 && *p < SYNID_CLUSTER23000)
4163 {
4164 msg_puts("CONTAINED");
4165 }
4166 else if (*p >= SYNID_CLUSTER23000)
4167 {
4168 short scl_id = *p - SYNID_CLUSTER23000;
4169
4170 msg_putchar('@');
4171 msg_outtrans(SYN_CLSTR(curwin->w_s)((syn_cluster_T *)((curwin->w_s)->b_syn_clusters.ga_data
))[scl_id].scl_name);
4172 }
4173 else
4174 msg_outtrans(highlight_group_name(*p - 1));
4175 if (p[1])
4176 msg_putchar(',');
4177 }
4178 msg_putchar(' ');
4179}
4180
4181 static void
4182put_pattern(
4183 char *s,
4184 int c,
4185 synpat_T *spp,
4186 int attr)
4187{
4188 long n;
4189 int mask;
4190 int first;
4191 static char *sepchars = "/+=-#@\"|'^&";
4192 int i;
4193
4194 // May have to write "matchgroup=group"
4195 if (last_matchgroup != spp->sp_syn_match_id)
4196 {
4197 last_matchgroup = spp->sp_syn_match_id;
4198 msg_puts_attr("matchgroup", attr);
4199 msg_putchar('=');
4200 if (last_matchgroup == 0)
4201 msg_outtrans((char_u *)"NONE");
4202 else
4203 msg_outtrans(highlight_group_name(last_matchgroup - 1));
4204 msg_putchar(' ');
4205 }
4206
4207 // output the name of the pattern and an '=' or ' '
4208 msg_puts_attr(s, attr);
4209 msg_putchar(c);
4210
4211 // output the pattern, in between a char that is not in the pattern
4212 for (i = 0; vim_strchr(spp->sp_pattern, sepchars[i]) != NULL((void*)0); )
4213 if (sepchars[++i] == NUL'\000')
4214 {
4215 i = 0; // no good char found, just use the first one
4216 break;
4217 }
4218 msg_putchar(sepchars[i]);
4219 msg_outtrans(spp->sp_pattern);
4220 msg_putchar(sepchars[i]);
4221
4222 // output any pattern options
4223 first = TRUE1;
4224 for (i = 0; i < SPO_COUNT7; ++i)
4225 {
4226 mask = (1 << i);
4227 if (spp->sp_off_flags & (mask + (mask << SPO_COUNT7)))
4228 {
4229 if (!first)
4230 msg_putchar(','); // separate with commas
4231 msg_puts(spo_name_tab[i]);
4232 n = spp->sp_offsets[i];
4233 if (i != SPO_LC_OFF6)
4234 {
4235 if (spp->sp_off_flags & mask)
4236 msg_putchar('s');
4237 else
4238 msg_putchar('e');
4239 if (n > 0)
4240 msg_putchar('+');
4241 }
4242 if (n || i == SPO_LC_OFF6)
4243 msg_outnum(n);
4244 first = FALSE0;
4245 }
4246 }
4247 msg_putchar(' ');
4248}
4249
4250/*
4251 * List or clear the keywords for one syntax group.
4252 * Return TRUE if the header has been printed.
4253 */
4254 static int
4255syn_list_keywords(
4256 int id,
4257 hashtab_T *ht,
4258 int did_header, // header has already been printed
4259 int attr)
4260{
4261 int outlen;
4262 hashitem_T *hi;
4263 keyentry_T *kp;
4264 int todo;
4265 int prev_contained = 0;
4266 short *prev_next_list = NULL((void*)0);
4267 short *prev_cont_in_list = NULL((void*)0);
4268 int prev_skipnl = 0;
4269 int prev_skipwhite = 0;
4270 int prev_skipempty = 0;
4271
4272 /*
4273 * Unfortunately, this list of keywords is not sorted on alphabet but on
4274 * hash value...
4275 */
4276 todo = (int)ht->ht_used;
4277 for (hi = ht->ht_array; todo > 0 && !got_int; ++hi)
4278 {
4279 if (!HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == &hash_removed
))
4280 {
4281 --todo;
4282 for (kp = HI2KE(hi)((keyentry_T *)(((hi)->hi_key) - (dumkey.keyword - (char_u
*)&dumkey))); kp != NULL((void*)0) && !got_int; kp = kp->ke_next)
4283 {
4284 if (kp->k_syn.id == id)
4285 {
4286 if (prev_contained != (kp->flags & HL_CONTAINED0x01)
4287 || prev_skipnl != (kp->flags & HL_SKIPNL0x80)
4288 || prev_skipwhite != (kp->flags & HL_SKIPWHITE0x100)
4289 || prev_skipempty != (kp->flags & HL_SKIPEMPTY0x200)
4290 || prev_cont_in_list != kp->k_syn.cont_in_list
4291 || prev_next_list != kp->next_list)
4292 outlen = 9999;
4293 else
4294 outlen = (int)STRLEN(kp->keyword)strlen((char *)(kp->keyword));
4295 // output "contained" and "nextgroup" on each line
4296 if (syn_list_header(did_header, outlen, id))
4297 {
4298 prev_contained = 0;
4299 prev_next_list = NULL((void*)0);
4300 prev_cont_in_list = NULL((void*)0);
4301 prev_skipnl = 0;
4302 prev_skipwhite = 0;
4303 prev_skipempty = 0;
4304 }
4305 did_header = TRUE1;
4306 if (prev_contained != (kp->flags & HL_CONTAINED0x01))
4307 {
4308 msg_puts_attr("contained", attr);
4309 msg_putchar(' ');
4310 prev_contained = (kp->flags & HL_CONTAINED0x01);
4311 }
4312 if (kp->k_syn.cont_in_list != prev_cont_in_list)
4313 {
4314 put_id_list((char_u *)"containedin",
4315 kp->k_syn.cont_in_list, attr);
4316 msg_putchar(' ');
4317 prev_cont_in_list = kp->k_syn.cont_in_list;
4318 }
4319 if (kp->next_list != prev_next_list)
4320 {
4321 put_id_list((char_u *)"nextgroup", kp->next_list, attr);
4322 msg_putchar(' ');
4323 prev_next_list = kp->next_list;
4324 if (kp->flags & HL_SKIPNL0x80)
4325 {
4326 msg_puts_attr("skipnl", attr);
4327 msg_putchar(' ');
4328 prev_skipnl = (kp->flags & HL_SKIPNL0x80);
4329 }
4330 if (kp->flags & HL_SKIPWHITE0x100)
4331 {
4332 msg_puts_attr("skipwhite", attr);
4333 msg_putchar(' ');
4334 prev_skipwhite = (kp->flags & HL_SKIPWHITE0x100);
4335 }
4336 if (kp->flags & HL_SKIPEMPTY0x200)
4337 {
4338 msg_puts_attr("skipempty", attr);
4339 msg_putchar(' ');
4340 prev_skipempty = (kp->flags & HL_SKIPEMPTY0x200);
4341 }
4342 }
4343 msg_outtrans(kp->keyword);
4344 }
4345 }
4346 }
4347 }
4348
4349 return did_header;
4350}
4351
4352 static void
4353syn_clear_keyword(int id, hashtab_T *ht)
4354{
4355 hashitem_T *hi;
4356 keyentry_T *kp;
4357 keyentry_T *kp_prev;
4358 keyentry_T *kp_next;
4359 int todo;
4360
4361 hash_lock(ht);
4362 todo = (int)ht->ht_used;
4363 for (hi = ht->ht_array; todo > 0; ++hi)
4364 {
4365 if (!HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == &hash_removed
))
4366 {
4367 --todo;
4368 kp_prev = NULL((void*)0);
4369 for (kp = HI2KE(hi)((keyentry_T *)(((hi)->hi_key) - (dumkey.keyword - (char_u
*)&dumkey))); kp != NULL((void*)0); )
4370 {
4371 if (kp->k_syn.id == id)
4372 {
4373 kp_next = kp->ke_next;
4374 if (kp_prev == NULL((void*)0))
4375 {
4376 if (kp_next == NULL((void*)0))
4377 hash_remove(ht, hi);
4378 else
4379 hi->hi_key = KE2HIKEY(kp_next)((kp_next)->keyword);
4380 }
4381 else
4382 kp_prev->ke_next = kp_next;
4383 vim_free(kp->next_list);
4384 vim_free(kp->k_syn.cont_in_list);
4385 vim_free(kp);
4386 kp = kp_next;
4387 }
4388 else
4389 {
4390 kp_prev = kp;
4391 kp = kp->ke_next;
4392 }
4393 }
4394 }
4395 }
4396 hash_unlock(ht);
4397}

4399/*
4400 * Clear a whole keyword table.
4401 */
4402 static void
4403clear_keywtab(hashtab_T *ht)
4404{
4405 hashitem_T *hi;
4406 int todo;
4407 keyentry_T *kp;
4408 keyentry_T *kp_next;
4409
4410 todo = (int)ht->ht_used;
4411 for (hi = ht->ht_array; todo > 0; ++hi)
4412 {
4413 if (!HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == &hash_removed
))
4414 {
4415 --todo;
4416 for (kp = HI2KE(hi)((keyentry_T *)(((hi)->hi_key) - (dumkey.keyword - (char_u
*)&dumkey))); kp != NULL((void*)0); kp = kp_next)
4417 {
4418 kp_next = kp->ke_next;
4419 vim_free(kp->next_list);
4420 vim_free(kp->k_syn.cont_in_list);
4421 vim_free(kp);
4422 }
4423 }
4424 }
4425 hash_clear(ht);
4426 hash_init(ht);
4427}

4429/*
4430 * Add a keyword to the list of keywords.
4431 */
4432 static void
4433add_keyword(
4434 char_u *name, // name of keyword
4435 int id, // group ID for this keyword
4436 int flags, // flags for this keyword
4437 short *cont_in_list, // containedin for this keyword
4438 short *next_list, // nextgroup for this keyword
4439 int conceal_char)
4440{
4441 keyentry_T *kp;
4442 hashtab_T *ht;
4443 hashitem_T *hi;
4444 char_u *name_ic;
4445 long_u hash;
4446 char_u name_folded[MAXKEYWLEN80 + 1];
4447
4448 if (curwin->w_s->b_syn_ic)
4449 name_ic = str_foldcase(name, (int)STRLEN(name)strlen((char *)(name)),
4450 name_folded, MAXKEYWLEN80 + 1);
4451 else
4452 name_ic = name;
4453 kp = alloc(offsetof(keyentry_T, keyword)__builtin_offsetof(keyentry_T, keyword) + STRLEN(name_ic)strlen((char *)(name_ic)) + 1);
4454 if (kp == NULL((void*)0))
4455 return;
4456 STRCPY(kp->keyword, name_ic)strcpy((char *)(kp->keyword), (char *)(name_ic));
4457 kp->k_syn.id = id;
4458 kp->k_syn.inc_tag = current_syn_inc_tag;
4459 kp->flags = flags;
4460 kp->k_char = conceal_char;
4461 kp->k_syn.cont_in_list = copy_id_list(cont_in_list);
4462 if (cont_in_list != NULL((void*)0))
4463 curwin->w_s->b_syn_containedin = TRUE1;
4464 kp->next_list = copy_id_list(next_list);
4465
4466 if (curwin->w_s->b_syn_ic)
4467 ht = &curwin->w_s->b_keywtab_ic;
4468 else
4469 ht = &curwin->w_s->b_keywtab;
4470
4471 hash = hash_hash(kp->keyword);
4472 hi = hash_lookup(ht, kp->keyword, hash);
4473 if (HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == &hash_removed
))
4474 {
4475 // new keyword, add to hashtable
4476 kp->ke_next = NULL((void*)0);
4477 hash_add_item(ht, hi, kp->keyword, hash);
4478 }
4479 else
4480 {
4481 // keyword already exists, prepend to list
4482 kp->ke_next = HI2KE(hi)((keyentry_T *)(((hi)->hi_key) - (dumkey.keyword - (char_u
*)&dumkey)));
4483 hi->hi_key = KE2HIKEY(kp)((kp)->keyword);
4484 }
4485}

4487/*
4488 * Get the start and end of the group name argument.
4489 * Return a pointer to the first argument.
4490 * Return NULL if the end of the command was found instead of further args.
4491 */
4492 static char_u *
4493get_group_name(
4494 char_u *arg, // start of the argument
4495 char_u **name_end) // pointer to end of the name
4496{
4497 char_u *rest;
4498
4499 *name_end = skiptowhite(arg);
4500 rest = skipwhite(*name_end);
4501
4502 /*
4503 * Check if there are enough arguments. The first argument may be a
4504 * pattern, where '|' is allowed, so only check for NUL.
4505 */
4506 if (ends_excmd(*arg) || *rest == NUL'\000')
4507 return NULL((void*)0);
4508 return rest;
4509}
4510
4511/*
4512 * Check for syntax command option arguments.
4513 * This can be called at any place in the list of arguments, and just picks
4514 * out the arguments that are known. Can be called several times in a row to
4515 * collect all options in between other arguments.
4516 * Return a pointer to the next argument (which isn't an option).
4517 * Return NULL for any error;
4518 */
4519 static char_u *
4520get_syn_options(
4521 char_u *start, // next argument to be checked
4522 syn_opt_arg_T *opt, // various things
4523 int *conceal_char UNUSED__attribute__((unused)),
4524 int skip) // TRUE if skipping over command
4525{
4526 char_u *arg = start;
4527 char_u *gname_start, *gname;
4528 int syn_id;
4529 int len;
4530 char *p;
4531 int i;
4532 int fidx;
4533 static struct flag
4534 {
4535 char *name;
4536 int argtype;
4537 int flags;
4538 } flagtab[] = { {"cCoOnNtTaAiInNeEdD", 0, HL_CONTAINED0x01},
4539 {"oOnNeElLiInNeE", 0, HL_ONELINE0x04},
4540 {"kKeEeEpPeEnNdD", 0, HL_KEEPEND0x400},
4541 {"eExXtTeEnNdD", 0, HL_EXTEND0x4000},
4542 {"eExXcClLuUdDeEnNlL", 0, HL_EXCLUDENL0x800},
4543 {"tTrRaAnNsSpPaArReEnNtT", 0, HL_TRANSP0x02},
4544 {"sSkKiIpPnNlL", 0, HL_SKIPNL0x80},
4545 {"sSkKiIpPwWhHiItTeE", 0, HL_SKIPWHITE0x100},
4546 {"sSkKiIpPeEmMpPtTyY", 0, HL_SKIPEMPTY0x200},
4547 {"gGrRoOuUpPhHeErReE", 0, HL_SYNC_HERE0x10},
4548 {"gGrRoOuUpPtThHeErReE", 0, HL_SYNC_THERE0x20},
4549 {"dDiIsSpPlLaAyY", 0, HL_DISPLAY0x1000},
4550 {"fFoOlLdD", 0, HL_FOLD0x2000},
4551 {"cCoOnNcCeEaAlL", 0, HL_CONCEAL0x20000},
4552 {"cCoOnNcCeEaAlLeEnNdDsS", 0, HL_CONCEALENDS0x40000},
4553 {"cCcChHaArR", 11, 0},
4554 {"cCoOnNtTaAiInNsS", 1, 0},
4555 {"cCoOnNtTaAiInNeEdDiInN", 2, 0},
4556 {"nNeExXtTgGrRoOuUpP", 3, 0},
4557 };
4558 static char *first_letters = "cCoOkKeEtTsSgGdDfFnN";
4559
4560 if (arg == NULL((void*)0)) // already detected error
4561 return NULL((void*)0);
4562
4563#ifdef FEAT_CONCEAL
4564 if (curwin->w_s->b_syn_conceal)
4565 opt->flags |= HL_CONCEAL0x20000;
4566#endif
4567
4568 for (;;)
4569 {
4570 /*
4571 * This is used very often when a large number of keywords is defined.
4572 * Need to skip quickly when no option name is found.
4573 * Also avoid tolower(), it's slow.
4574 */
4575 if (strchr(first_letters, *arg) == NULL((void*)0))
4576 break;
4577
4578 for (fidx = sizeof(flagtab) / sizeof(struct flag); --fidx >= 0; )
4579 {
4580 p = flagtab[fidx].name;
4581 for (i = 0, len = 0; p[i] != NUL'\000'; i += 2, ++len)
4582 if (arg[len] != p[i] && arg[len] != p[i + 1])
4583 break;
4584 if (p[i] == NUL'\000' && (VIM_ISWHITE(arg[len])((arg[len]) == ' ' || (arg[len]) == '\t')
4585 || (flagtab[fidx].argtype > 0
4586 ? arg[len] == '='
4587 : ends_excmd2(start, arg + len))))
4588 {
4589 if (opt->keyword
4590 && (flagtab[fidx].flags == HL_DISPLAY0x1000
4591 || flagtab[fidx].flags == HL_FOLD0x2000
4592 || flagtab[fidx].flags == HL_EXTEND0x4000))
4593 // treat "display", "fold" and "extend" as a keyword
4594 fidx = -1;
4595 break;
4596 }
4597 }
4598 if (fidx < 0) // no match found
4599 break;
4600
4601 if (flagtab[fidx].argtype == 1)
4602 {
4603 if (!opt->has_cont_list)
4604 {
4605 emsg(_("E395: contains argument not accepted here")dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)("E395: contains argument not accepted here"
), 5));
4606 return NULL((void*)0);
4607 }
4608 if (get_id_list(&arg, 8, &opt->cont_list, skip) == FAIL0)
4609 return NULL((void*)0);
4610 }
4611 else if (flagtab[fidx].argtype == 2)
4612 {
4613 if (get_id_list(&arg, 11, &opt->cont_in_list, skip) == FAIL0)
4614 return NULL((void*)0);
4615 }
4616 else if (flagtab[fidx].argtype == 3)
4617 {
4618 if (get_id_list(&arg, 9, &opt->next_list, skip) == FAIL0)
4619 return NULL((void*)0);
4620 }
4621 else if (flagtab[fidx].argtype == 11 && arg[5] == '=')
4622 {
4623 // cchar=?
4624 if (has_mbyte)
4625 {
4626#ifdef FEAT_CONCEAL
4627 *conceal_char = mb_ptr2char(arg + 6);
4628#endif
4629 arg += mb_ptr2len(arg + 6) - 1;
4630 }
4631 else
4632 {
4633#ifdef FEAT_CONCEAL
4634 *conceal_char = arg[6];
4635#else
4636 ;
4637#endif
4638 }
4639#ifdef FEAT_CONCEAL
4640 if (!vim_isprintc_strict(*conceal_char))
4641 {
4642 emsg(_("E844: invalid cchar value")dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)("E844: invalid cchar value"),
5));
4643 return NULL((void*)0);
4644 }
4645#endif
4646 arg = skipwhite(arg + 7);
4647 }
4648 else
4649 {
4650 opt->flags |= flagtab[fidx].flags;
4651 arg = skipwhite(arg + len);
4652
4653 if (flagtab[fidx].flags == HL_SYNC_HERE0x10
4654 || flagtab[fidx].flags == HL_SYNC_THERE0x20)
4655 {
4656 if (opt->sync_idx == NULL((void*)0))
4657 {
4658 emsg(_("E393: group[t]here not accepted here")dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)("E393: group[t]here not accepted here"
), 5));
4659 return NULL((void*)0);
4660 }
4661 gname_start = arg;
4662 arg = skiptowhite(arg);
4663 if (gname_start == arg)
4664 return NULL((void*)0);
4665 gname = vim_strnsave(gname_start, arg - gname_start);
4666 if (gname == NULL((void*)0))
4667 return NULL((void*)0);
4668 if (STRCMP(gname, "NONE")strcmp((char *)(gname), (char *)("NONE")) == 0)
4669 *opt->sync_idx = NONE_IDX-2;
4670 else
4671 {
4672 syn_id = syn_name2id(gname);
4673 for (i = curwin->w_s->b_syn_patterns.ga_len; --i >= 0; )
4674 if (SYN_ITEMS(curwin->w_s)((synpat_T *)((curwin->w_s)->b_syn_patterns.ga_data))[i].sp_syn.id == syn_id
4675 && SYN_ITEMS(curwin->w_s)((synpat_T *)((curwin->w_s)->b_syn_patterns.ga_data))[i].sp_type
4676 == SPTYPE_START2)
4677 {
4678 *opt->sync_idx = i;
4679 break;
4680 }
4681 if (i < 0)
4682 {
4683 semsg(_("E394: Didn't find region item for %s")dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)("E394: Didn't find region item for %s"
), 5), gname);
4684 vim_free(gname);
4685 return NULL((void*)0);
4686 }
4687 }
4688
4689 vim_free(gname);
4690 arg = skipwhite(arg);
4691 }
4692#ifdef FEAT_FOLDING
4693 else if (flagtab[fidx].flags == HL_FOLD0x2000
4694 && foldmethodIsSyntax(curwin))
4695 // Need to update folds later.
4696 foldUpdateAll(curwin);
4697#endif
4698 }
4699 }
4700
4701 return arg;
4702}
4703
4704/*
4705 * Adjustments to syntax item when declared in a ":syn include"'d file.
4706 * Set the contained flag, and if the item is not already contained, add it
4707 * to the specified top-level group, if any.
4708 */
4709 static void
4710syn_incl_toplevel(int id, int *flagsp)
4711{
4712 if ((*flagsp & HL_CONTAINED0x01) || curwin->w_s->b_syn_topgrp == 0)
4713 return;
4714 *flagsp |= HL_CONTAINED0x01;
4715 if (curwin->w_s->b_syn_topgrp >= SYNID_CLUSTER23000)
4716 {
4717 // We have to alloc this, because syn_combine_list() will free it.
4718 short *grp_list = ALLOC_MULT(short, 2)(short *)alloc(sizeof(short) * (2));
4719 int tlg_id = curwin->w_s->b_syn_topgrp - SYNID_CLUSTER23000;
4720
4721 if (grp_list != NULL((void*)0))
4722 {
4723 grp_list[0] = id;
4724 grp_list[1] = 0;
4725 syn_combine_list(&SYN_CLSTR(curwin->w_s)((syn_cluster_T *)((curwin->w_s)->b_syn_clusters.ga_data
))[tlg_id].scl_list,
4726 &grp_list, CLUSTER_ADD2);
4727 }
4728 }
4729}
4730
4731/*
4732 * Handle ":syntax include [@{group-name}] filename" command.
4733 */
4734 static void
4735syn_cmd_include(exarg_T *eap, int syncing UNUSED__attribute__((unused)))
4736{
4737 char_u *arg = eap->arg;
4738 int sgl_id = 1;
4739 char_u *group_name_end;
4740 char_u *rest;
4741 char *errormsg = NULL((void*)0);
4742 int prev_toplvl_grp;
4743 int prev_syn_inc_tag;
4744 int source = FALSE0;
4745
4746 eap->nextcmd = find_nextcmd(arg);
4747 if (eap->skip)
4748 return;
4749
4750 if (arg[0] == '@')
4751 {
4752 ++arg;
4753 rest = get_group_name(arg, &group_name_end);
4754 if (rest == NULL((void*)0))
4755 {
4756 emsg(_("E397: Filename required")dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)("E397: Filename required"), 5
));
4757 return;
4758 }
4759 sgl_id = syn_check_cluster(arg, (int)(group_name_end - arg));
4760 if (sgl_id == 0)
4761 return;
4762 // separate_nextcmd() and expand_filename() depend on this
4763 eap->arg = rest;
4764 }
4765
4766 /*
4767 * Everything that's left, up to the next command, should be the
4768 * filename to include.
4769 */
4770 eap->argt |= (EX_XFILE0x008 | EX_NOSPC0x010);
4771 separate_nextcmd(eap);
4772 if (*eap->arg == '<' || *eap->arg == '$' || mch_isFullName(eap->arg))
4773 {
4774 // For an absolute path, "$VIM/..." or "<sfile>.." we ":source" the
4775 // file. Need to expand the file name first. In other cases
4776 // ":runtime!" is used.
4777 source = TRUE1;
4778 if (expand_filename(eap, syn_cmdlinep, &errormsg) == FAIL0)
4779 {
4780 if (errormsg != NULL((void*)0))
4781 emsg(errormsg);
4782 return;
4783 }
4784 }
4785
4786 /*
4787 * Save and restore the existing top-level grouplist id and ":syn
4788 * include" tag around the actual inclusion.
4789 */
4790 if (running_syn_inc_tag >= MAX_SYN_INC_TAG999)
4791 {
4792 emsg(_("E847: Too many syntax includes")dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)("E847: Too many syntax includes"
), 5));
4793 return;
4794 }
4795 prev_syn_inc_tag = current_syn_inc_tag;
4796 current_syn_inc_tag = ++running_syn_inc_tag;
4797 prev_toplvl_grp = curwin->w_s->b_syn_topgrp;
4798 curwin->w_s->b_syn_topgrp = sgl_id;
4799 if (source ? do_source(eap->arg, FALSE0, DOSO_NONE0, NULL((void*)0)) == FAIL0
4800 : source_runtime(eap->arg, DIP_ALL0x01) == FAIL0)
4801 semsg(_(e_notopen)dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)(e_notopen), 5), eap->arg);
4802 curwin->w_s->b_syn_topgrp = prev_toplvl_grp;
4803 current_syn_inc_tag = prev_syn_inc_tag;
4804}
4805
4806/*
4807 * Handle ":syntax keyword {group-name} [{option}] keyword .." command.
4808 */
4809 static void
4810syn_cmd_keyword(exarg_T *eap, int syncing UNUSED__attribute__((unused)))
4811{
4812 char_u *arg = eap->arg;
4813 char_u *group_name_end;
4814 int syn_id;
4815 char_u *rest;
4816 char_u *keyword_copy = NULL((void*)0);
4817 char_u *p;
4818 char_u *kw;
4819 syn_opt_arg_T syn_opt_arg;
4820 int cnt;
4821 int conceal_char = NUL'\000';
4822
4823 rest = get_group_name(arg, &group_name_end);
4824
4825 if (rest != NULL((void*)0))
4826 {
4827 if (eap->skip)
4828 syn_id = -1;
4829 else
4830 syn_id = syn_check_group(arg, (int)(group_name_end - arg));
4831 if (syn_id != 0)
4832 // allocate a buffer, for removing backslashes in the keyword
4833 keyword_copy = alloc(STRLEN(rest)strlen((char *)(rest)) + 1);
4834 if (keyword_copy != NULL((void*)0))
4835 {
4836 syn_opt_arg.flags = 0;
4837 syn_opt_arg.keyword = TRUE1;
4838 syn_opt_arg.sync_idx = NULL((void*)0);
4839 syn_opt_arg.has_cont_list = FALSE0;
4840 syn_opt_arg.cont_in_list = NULL((void*)0);
4841 syn_opt_arg.next_list = NULL((void*)0);
4842
4843 /*
4844 * The options given apply to ALL keywords, so all options must be
4845 * found before keywords can be created.
4846 * 1: collect the options and copy the keywords to keyword_copy.
4847 */
4848 cnt = 0;
4849 p = keyword_copy;
4850 for ( ; rest != NULL((void*)0) && !ends_excmd2(eap->arg, rest);
4851 rest = skipwhite(rest))
4852 {
4853 rest = get_syn_options(rest, &syn_opt_arg, &conceal_char,
4854 eap->skip);
4855 if (rest == NULL((void*)0) || ends_excmd2(eap->arg, rest))
4856 break;
4857 // Copy the keyword, removing backslashes, and add a NUL.
4858 while (*rest != NUL'\000' && !VIM_ISWHITE(*rest)((*rest) == ' ' || (*rest) == '\t'))
4859 {
4860 if (*rest == '\\' && rest[1] != NUL'\000')
4861 ++rest;
4862 *p++ = *rest++;
4863 }
4864 *p++ = NUL'\000';
4865 ++cnt;
4866 }
4867
4868 if (!eap->skip)
4869 {
4870 // Adjust flags for use of ":syn include".
4871 syn_incl_toplevel(syn_id, &syn_opt_arg.flags);
4872
4873 /*
4874 * 2: Add an entry for each keyword.
4875 */
4876 for (kw = keyword_copy; --cnt >= 0; kw += STRLEN(kw)strlen((char *)(kw)) + 1)
4877 {
4878 for (p = vim_strchr(kw, '['); ; )
4879 {
4880 if (p != NULL((void*)0))
4881 *p = NUL'\000';
4882 add_keyword(kw, syn_id, syn_opt_arg.flags,
4883 syn_opt_arg.cont_in_list,
4884 syn_opt_arg.next_list, conceal_char);
4885 if (p == NULL((void*)0))
4886 break;
4887 if (p[1] == NUL'\000')
4888 {
4889 semsg(_("E789: Missing ']': %s")dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)("E789: Missing ']': %s"), 5), kw);
4890 goto error;
4891 }
4892 if (p[1] == ']')
4893 {
4894 if (p[2] != NUL'\000')
4895 {
4896 semsg(_("E890: trailing char after ']': %s]%s")dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)("E890: trailing char after ']': %s]%s"
), 5),
4897 kw, &p[2]);
4898 goto error;
4899 }
4900 kw = p + 1; // skip over the "]"
4901 break;
4902 }
4903 if (has_mbyte)
4904 {
4905 int l = (*mb_ptr2len)(p + 1);
4906
4907 mch_memmove(p, p + 1, l)memmove((char *)(p), (char *)(p + 1), l);
4908 p += l;
4909 }
4910 else
4911 {
4912 p[0] = p[1];
4913 ++p;
4914 }
4915 }
4916 }
4917 }
4918error:
4919 vim_free(keyword_copy);
4920 vim_free(syn_opt_arg.cont_in_list);
4921 vim_free(syn_opt_arg.next_list);
4922 }
4923 }
4924
4925 if (rest != NULL((void*)0))
4926 eap->nextcmd = check_nextcmd(rest);
4927 else
4928 semsg(_(e_invarg2)dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)(e_invarg2), 5), arg);
4929
4930 redraw_curbuf_later(SOME_VALID35);
4931 syn_stack_free_all(curwin->w_s); // Need to recompute all syntax.
4932}
4933
4934/*
4935 * Handle ":syntax match {name} [{options}] {pattern} [{options}]".
4936 *
4937 * Also ":syntax sync match {name} [[grouphere | groupthere] {group-name}] .."
4938 */
4939 static void
4940syn_cmd_match(
4941 exarg_T *eap,
4942 int syncing) // TRUE for ":syntax sync match .. "
4943{
4944 char_u *arg = eap->arg;
4945 char_u *group_name_end;
4946 char_u *rest;
4947 synpat_T item; // the item found in the line
4948 int syn_id;
4949 int idx;
4950 syn_opt_arg_T syn_opt_arg;
4951 int sync_idx = 0;
4952 int conceal_char = NUL'\000';
4953 int orig_called_emsg = called_emsg;
4954
4955 // Isolate the group name, check for validity
4956 rest = get_group_name(arg, &group_name_end);
4957
4958 // Get options before the pattern
4959 syn_opt_arg.flags = 0;
4960 syn_opt_arg.keyword = FALSE0;
4961 syn_opt_arg.sync_idx = syncing ? &sync_idx : NULL((void*)0);
4962 syn_opt_arg.has_cont_list = TRUE1;
4963 syn_opt_arg.cont_list = NULL((void*)0);
4964 syn_opt_arg.cont_in_list = NULL((void*)0);
4965 syn_opt_arg.next_list = NULL((void*)0);
4966 rest = get_syn_options(rest, &syn_opt_arg, &conceal_char, eap->skip);
4967
4968 // get the pattern.
4969 init_syn_patterns();
4970 CLEAR_FIELD(item)memset((&(item)), (0), (sizeof(item)));
4971 rest = get_syn_pattern(rest, &item);
4972 if (vim_regcomp_had_eol() && !(syn_opt_arg.flags & HL_EXCLUDENL0x800))
4973 syn_opt_arg.flags |= HL_HAS_EOL0x08;
4974
4975 // Get options after the pattern
4976 rest = get_syn_options(rest, &syn_opt_arg, &conceal_char, eap->skip);
4977
4978 if (rest != NULL((void*)0)) // all arguments are valid
4979 {
4980 /*
4981 * Check for trailing command and illegal trailing arguments.
4982 */
4983 eap->nextcmd = check_nextcmd(rest);
4984 if (!ends_excmd2(eap->cmd, rest) || eap->skip)
4985 rest = NULL((void*)0);
4986 else if (ga_grow(&curwin->w_s->b_syn_patterns, 1) != FAIL0
4987 && (syn_id = syn_check_group(arg,
4988 (int)(group_name_end - arg))) != 0)
4989 {
4990 syn_incl_toplevel(syn_id, &syn_opt_arg.flags);
4991 /*
4992 * Store the pattern in the syn_items list
4993 */
4994 idx = curwin->w_s->b_syn_patterns.ga_len;
4995 SYN_ITEMS(curwin->w_s)((synpat_T *)((curwin->w_s)->b_syn_patterns.ga_data))[idx] = item;
4996 SYN_ITEMS(curwin->w_s)((synpat_T *)((curwin->w_s)->b_syn_patterns.ga_data))[idx].sp_syncing = syncing;
4997 SYN_ITEMS(curwin->w_s)((synpat_T *)((curwin->w_s)->b_syn_patterns.ga_data))[idx].sp_type = SPTYPE_MATCH1;
4998 SYN_ITEMS(curwin->w_s)((synpat_T *)((curwin->w_s)->b_syn_patterns.ga_data))[idx].sp_syn.id = syn_id;
4999 SYN_ITEMS(curwin->w_s)((synpat_T *)((curwin->w_s)->b_syn_patterns.ga_data))[idx].sp_syn.inc_tag = current_syn_inc_tag;
5000 SYN_ITEMS(curwin->w_s)((synpat_T *)((curwin->w_s)->b_syn_patterns.ga_data))[idx].sp_flags = syn_opt_arg.flags;
5001 SYN_ITEMS(curwin->w_s)((synpat_T *)((curwin->w_s)->b_syn_patterns.ga_data))[idx].sp_sync_idx = sync_idx;
5002 SYN_ITEMS(curwin->w_s)((synpat_T *)((curwin->w_s)->b_syn_patterns.ga_data))[idx].sp_cont_list = syn_opt_arg.cont_list;
5003 SYN_ITEMS(curwin->w_s)((synpat_T *)((curwin->w_s)->b_syn_patterns.ga_data))[idx].sp_syn.cont_in_list =
5004 syn_opt_arg.cont_in_list;
5005#ifdef FEAT_CONCEAL
5006 SYN_ITEMS(curwin->w_s)((synpat_T *)((curwin->w_s)->b_syn_patterns.ga_data))[idx].sp_cchar = conceal_char;
5007#endif
5008 if (syn_opt_arg.cont_in_list != NULL((void*)0))
5009 curwin->w_s->b_syn_containedin = TRUE1;
5010 SYN_ITEMS(curwin->w_s)((synpat_T *)((curwin->w_s)->b_syn_patterns.ga_data))[idx].sp_next_list = syn_opt_arg.next_list;
5011 ++curwin->w_s->b_syn_patterns.ga_len;
5012
5013 // remember that we found a match for syncing on
5014 if (syn_opt_arg.flags & (HL_SYNC_HERE0x10|HL_SYNC_THERE0x20))
5015 curwin->w_s->b_syn_sync_flags |= SF_MATCH0x02;
5016#ifdef FEAT_FOLDING
5017 if (syn_opt_arg.flags & HL_FOLD0x2000)
5018 ++curwin->w_s->b_syn_folditems;
5019#endif
5020
5021 redraw_curbuf_later(SOME_VALID35);
5022 syn_stack_free_all(curwin->w_s); // Need to recompute all syntax.
5023 return; // don't free the progs and patterns now
5024 }
5025 }
5026
5027 /*
5028 * Something failed, free the allocated memory.
5029 */
5030 vim_regfree(item.sp_prog);
5031 vim_free(item.sp_pattern);
5032 vim_free(syn_opt_arg.cont_list);
5033 vim_free(syn_opt_arg.cont_in_list);
5034 vim_free(syn_opt_arg.next_list);
5035
5036 if (rest == NULL((void*)0) && called_emsg == orig_called_emsg)
5037 semsg(_(e_invarg2)dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)(e_invarg2), 5), arg);
5038}
5039
5040/*
5041 * Handle ":syntax region {group-name} [matchgroup={group-name}]
5042 * start {start} .. [skip {skip}] end {end} .. [{options}]".
5043 */
5044 static void
5045syn_cmd_region(
5046 exarg_T *eap,
5047 int syncing) // TRUE for ":syntax sync region .."
5048{
5049 char_u *arg = eap->arg;
5050 char_u *group_name_end;
5051 char_u *rest; // next arg, NULL on error
5052 char_u *key_end;
5053 char_u *key = NULL((void*)0);
5054 char_u *p;
5055 int item;
5056#define ITEM_START0 0
5057#define ITEM_SKIP1 1
5058#define ITEM_END2 2
5059#define ITEM_MATCHGROUP3 3
5060 struct pat_ptr
5061 {
5062 synpat_T *pp_synp; // pointer to syn_pattern
5063 int pp_matchgroup_id; // matchgroup ID
5064 struct pat_ptr *pp_next; // pointer to next pat_ptr
5065 } *(pat_ptrs[3]);
5066 // patterns found in the line
5067 struct pat_ptr *ppp;
5068 struct pat_ptr *ppp_next;
5069 int pat_count = 0; // nr of syn_patterns found
5070 int syn_id;
5071 int matchgroup_id = 0;
5072 int not_enough = FALSE0; // not enough arguments
5073 int illegal = FALSE0; // illegal arguments
5074 int success = FALSE0;
5075 int idx;
5076 syn_opt_arg_T syn_opt_arg;
5077 int conceal_char = NUL'\000';
5078
5079 // Isolate the group name, check for validity
5080 rest = get_group_name(arg, &group_name_end);
5081
5082 pat_ptrs[0] = NULL((void*)0);
5083 pat_ptrs[1] = NULL((void*)0);
5084 pat_ptrs[2] = NULL((void*)0);
5085
5086 init_syn_patterns();
5087
5088 syn_opt_arg.flags = 0;
5089 syn_opt_arg.keyword = FALSE0;
5090 syn_opt_arg.sync_idx = NULL((void*)0);
5091 syn_opt_arg.has_cont_list = TRUE1;
5092 syn_opt_arg.cont_list = NULL((void*)0);
5093 syn_opt_arg.cont_in_list = NULL((void*)0);
5094 syn_opt_arg.next_list = NULL((void*)0);
5095
5096 /*
5097 * get the options, patterns and matchgroup.
5098 */
5099 while (rest != NULL((void*)0) && !ends_excmd2(eap->cmd, rest))
5100 {
5101 // Check for option arguments
5102 rest = get_syn_options(rest, &syn_opt_arg, &conceal_char, eap->skip);
5103 if (rest == NULL((void*)0) || ends_excmd2(eap->cmd, rest))
5104 break;
5105
5106 // must be a pattern or matchgroup then
5107 key_end = rest;
5108 while (*key_end && !VIM_ISWHITE(*key_end)((*key_end) == ' ' || (*key_end) == '\t') && *key_end != '=')
5109 ++key_end;
5110 vim_free(key);
5111 key = vim_strnsave_up(rest, key_end - rest);
5112 if (key == NULL((void*)0)) // out of memory
5113 {
5114 rest = NULL((void*)0);
5115 break;
5116 }
5117 if (STRCMP(key, "MATCHGROUP")strcmp((char *)(key), (char *)("MATCHGROUP")) == 0)
5118 item = ITEM_MATCHGROUP3;
5119 else if (STRCMP(key, "START")strcmp((char *)(key), (char *)("START")) == 0)
5120 item = ITEM_START0;
5121 else if (STRCMP(key, "END")strcmp((char *)(key), (char *)("END")) == 0)
5122 item = ITEM_END2;
5123 else if (STRCMP(key, "SKIP")strcmp((char *)(key), (char *)("SKIP")) == 0)
5124 {
5125 if (pat_ptrs[ITEM_SKIP1] != NULL((void*)0)) // one skip pattern allowed
5126 {
5127 illegal = TRUE1;
5128 break;
5129 }
5130 item = ITEM_SKIP1;
5131 }
5132 else
5133 break;
5134 rest = skipwhite(key_end);
5135 if (*rest != '=')
5136 {
5137 rest = NULL((void*)0);
5138 semsg(_("E398: Missing '=': %s")dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)("E398: Missing '=': %s"), 5), arg);
5139 break;
5140 }
5141 rest = skipwhite(rest + 1);
5142 if (*rest == NUL'\000')
5143 {
5144 not_enough = TRUE1;
5145 break;
5146 }
5147
5148 if (item == ITEM_MATCHGROUP3)
5149 {
5150 p = skiptowhite(rest);
5151 if ((p - rest == 4 && STRNCMP(rest, "NONE", 4)strncmp((char *)(rest), (char *)("NONE"), (size_t)(4)) == 0) || eap->skip)
5152 matchgroup_id = 0;
5153 else
5154 {
5155 matchgroup_id = syn_check_group(rest, (int)(p - rest));
5156 if (matchgroup_id == 0)
5157 {
5158 illegal = TRUE1;
5159 break;
5160 }
5161 }
5162 rest = skipwhite(p);
5163 }
5164 else
5165 {
5166 /*
5167 * Allocate room for a syn_pattern, and link it in the list of
5168 * syn_patterns for this item, at the start (because the list is
5169 * used from end to start).
5170 */
5171 ppp = ALLOC_ONE(struct pat_ptr)(struct pat_ptr *)alloc(sizeof(struct pat_ptr));
5172 if (ppp == NULL((void*)0))
5173 {
5174 rest = NULL((void*)0);
5175 break;
5176 }
5177 ppp->pp_next = pat_ptrs[item];
5178 pat_ptrs[item] = ppp;
5179 ppp->pp_synp = ALLOC_CLEAR_ONE(synpat_T)(synpat_T *)alloc_clear(sizeof(synpat_T));
5180 if (ppp->pp_synp == NULL((void*)0))
5181 {
5182 rest = NULL((void*)0);
5183 break;
5184 }
5185
5186 /*
5187 * Get the syntax pattern and the following offset(s).
5188 */
5189 // Enable the appropriate \z specials.
5190 if (item == ITEM_START0)
5191 reg_do_extmatch = REX_SET1;
5192 else if (item == ITEM_SKIP1 || item == ITEM_END2)
5193 reg_do_extmatch = REX_USE2;
5194 rest = get_syn_pattern(rest, ppp->pp_synp);
5195 reg_do_extmatch = 0;
5196 if (item == ITEM_END2 && vim_regcomp_had_eol()
5197 && !(syn_opt_arg.flags & HL_EXCLUDENL0x800))
5198 ppp->pp_synp->sp_flags |= HL_HAS_EOL0x08;
5199 ppp->pp_matchgroup_id = matchgroup_id;
5200 ++pat_count;
5201 }
5202 }
5203 vim_free(key);
5204 if (illegal || not_enough)
5205 rest = NULL((void*)0);
5206
5207 /*
5208 * Must have a "start" and "end" pattern.
5209 */
5210 if (rest != NULL((void*)0) && (pat_ptrs[ITEM_START0] == NULL((void*)0) ||
5211 pat_ptrs[ITEM_END2] == NULL((void*)0)))
5212 {
5213 not_enough = TRUE1;
5214 rest = NULL((void*)0);
5215 }
5216
5217 if (rest != NULL((void*)0))
5218 {
5219 /*
5220 * Check for trailing garbage or command.
5221 * If OK, add the item.
5222 */
5223 eap->nextcmd = check_nextcmd(rest);
5224 if (!ends_excmd(*rest) || eap->skip)
5225 rest = NULL((void*)0);
5226 else if (ga_grow(&(curwin->w_s->b_syn_patterns), pat_count) != FAIL0
5227 && (syn_id = syn_check_group(arg,
5228 (int)(group_name_end - arg))) != 0)
5229 {
5230 syn_incl_toplevel(syn_id, &syn_opt_arg.flags);
5231 /*
5232 * Store the start/skip/end in the syn_items list
5233 */
5234 idx = curwin->w_s->b_syn_patterns.ga_len;
5235 for (item = ITEM_START0; item <= ITEM_END2; ++item)
5236 {
5237 for (ppp = pat_ptrs[item]; ppp != NULL((void*)0); ppp = ppp->pp_next)
5238 {
5239 SYN_ITEMS(curwin->w_s)((synpat_T *)((curwin->w_s)->b_syn_patterns.ga_data))[idx] = *(ppp->pp_synp);
5240 SYN_ITEMS(curwin->w_s)((synpat_T *)((curwin->w_s)->b_syn_patterns.ga_data))[idx].sp_syncing = syncing;
5241 SYN_ITEMS(curwin->w_s)((synpat_T *)((curwin->w_s)->b_syn_patterns.ga_data))[idx].sp_type =
5242 (item == ITEM_START0) ? SPTYPE_START2 :
5243 (item == ITEM_SKIP1) ? SPTYPE_SKIP4 : SPTYPE_END3;
5244 SYN_ITEMS(curwin->w_s)((synpat_T *)((curwin->w_s)->b_syn_patterns.ga_data))[idx].sp_flags |= syn_opt_arg.flags;
5245 SYN_ITEMS(curwin->w_s)((synpat_T *)((curwin->w_s)->b_syn_patterns.ga_data))[idx].sp_syn.id = syn_id;
5246 SYN_ITEMS(curwin->w_s)((synpat_T *)((curwin->w_s)->b_syn_patterns.ga_data))[idx].sp_syn.inc_tag =
5247 current_syn_inc_tag;
5248 SYN_ITEMS(curwin->w_s)((synpat_T *)((curwin->w_s)->b_syn_patterns.ga_data))[idx].sp_syn_match_id =
5249 ppp->pp_matchgroup_id;
5250#ifdef FEAT_CONCEAL
5251 SYN_ITEMS(curwin->w_s)((synpat_T *)((curwin->w_s)->b_syn_patterns.ga_data))[idx].sp_cchar = conceal_char;
5252#endif
5253 if (item == ITEM_START0)
5254 {
5255 SYN_ITEMS(curwin->w_s)((synpat_T *)((curwin->w_s)->b_syn_patterns.ga_data))[idx].sp_cont_list =
5256 syn_opt_arg.cont_list;
5257 SYN_ITEMS(curwin->w_s)((synpat_T *)((curwin->w_s)->b_syn_patterns.ga_data))[idx].sp_syn.cont_in_list =
5258 syn_opt_arg.cont_in_list;
5259 if (syn_opt_arg.cont_in_list != NULL((void*)0))
5260 curwin->w_s->b_syn_containedin = TRUE1;
5261 SYN_ITEMS(curwin->w_s)((synpat_T *)((curwin->w_s)->b_syn_patterns.ga_data))[idx].sp_next_list =
5262 syn_opt_arg.next_list;
5263 }
5264 ++curwin->w_s->b_syn_patterns.ga_len;
5265 ++idx;
5266#ifdef FEAT_FOLDING
5267 if (syn_opt_arg.flags & HL_FOLD0x2000)
5268 ++curwin->w_s->b_syn_folditems;
5269#endif
5270 }
5271 }
5272
5273 redraw_curbuf_later(SOME_VALID35);
5274 syn_stack_free_all(curwin->w_s); // Need to recompute all syntax.
5275 success = TRUE1; // don't free the progs and patterns now
5276 }
5277 }
5278
5279 /*
5280 * Free the allocated memory.
5281 */
5282 for (item = ITEM_START0; item <= ITEM_END2; ++item)
5283 for (ppp = pat_ptrs[item]; ppp != NULL((void*)0); ppp = ppp_next)
5284 {
5285 if (!success && ppp->pp_synp != NULL((void*)0))
5286 {
5287 vim_regfree(ppp->pp_synp->sp_prog);
5288 vim_free(ppp->pp_synp->sp_pattern);
5289 }
5290 vim_free(ppp->pp_synp);
5291 ppp_next = ppp->pp_next;
5292 vim_free(ppp);
5293 }
5294
5295 if (!success)
5296 {
5297 vim_free(syn_opt_arg.cont_list);
5298 vim_free(syn_opt_arg.cont_in_list);
5299 vim_free(syn_opt_arg.next_list);
5300 if (not_enough)
5301 semsg(_("E399: Not enough arguments: syntax region %s")dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)("E399: Not enough arguments: syntax region %s"
), 5), arg);
5302 else if (illegal || rest == NULL((void*)0))
5303 semsg(_(e_invarg2)dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)(e_invarg2), 5), arg);
5304 }
5305}
5306
5307/*
5308 * A simple syntax group ID comparison function suitable for use in qsort()
5309 */
5310 static int
5311syn_compare_stub(const void *v1, const void *v2)
5312{
5313 const short *s1 = v1;
5314 const short *s2 = v2;
5315
5316 return (*s1 > *s2 ? 1 : *s1 < *s2 ? -1 : 0);
5317}
5318
5319/*
5320 * Combines lists of syntax clusters.
5321 * *clstr1 and *clstr2 must both be allocated memory; they will be consumed.
5322 */
5323 static void
5324syn_combine_list(short **clstr1, short **clstr2, int list_op)
5325{
5326 int count1 = 0;
5327 int count2 = 0;
5328 short *g1;
5329 short *g2;
5330 short *clstr = NULL((void*)0);
5331 int count;
5332 int round;
5333
5334 /*
5335 * Handle degenerate cases.
5336 */
5337 if (*clstr2 == NULL((void*)0))
5338 return;
5339 if (*clstr1 == NULL((void*)0) || list_op == CLUSTER_REPLACE1)
5340 {
5341 if (list_op == CLUSTER_REPLACE1)
5342 vim_free(*clstr1);
5343 if (list_op == CLUSTER_REPLACE1 || list_op == CLUSTER_ADD2)
5344 *clstr1 = *clstr2;
5345 else
5346 vim_free(*clstr2);
5347 return;
5348 }
5349
5350 for (g1 = *clstr1; *g1; g1++)
5351 ++count1;
5352 for (g2 = *clstr2; *g2; g2++)
5353 ++count2;
5354
5355 /*
5356 * For speed purposes, sort both lists.
5357 */
5358 qsort(*clstr1, (size_t)count1, sizeof(short), syn_compare_stub);
5359 qsort(*clstr2, (size_t)count2, sizeof(short), syn_compare_stub);
5360
5361 /*
5362 * We proceed in two passes; in round 1, we count the elements to place
5363 * in the new list, and in round 2, we allocate and populate the new
5364 * list. For speed, we use a mergesort-like method, adding the smaller
5365 * of the current elements in each list to the new list.
5366 */
5367 for (round = 1; round <= 2; round++)
5368 {
5369 g1 = *clstr1;
5370 g2 = *clstr2;
5371 count = 0;
5372
5373 /*
5374 * First, loop through the lists until one of them is empty.
5375 */
5376 while (*g1 && *g2)
5377 {
5378 /*
5379 * We always want to add from the first list.
5380 */
5381 if (*g1 < *g2)
5382 {
5383 if (round == 2)
5384 clstr[count] = *g1;
5385 count++;
5386 g1++;
5387 continue;
5388 }
5389 /*
5390 * We only want to add from the second list if we're adding the
5391 * lists.
5392 */
5393 if (list_op == CLUSTER_ADD2)
5394 {
5395 if (round == 2)
5396 clstr[count] = *g2;
5397 count++;
5398 }
5399 if (*g1 == *g2)
5400 g1++;
5401 g2++;
5402 }
5403
5404 /*
5405 * Now add the leftovers from whichever list didn't get finished
5406 * first. As before, we only want to add from the second list if
5407 * we're adding the lists.
5408 */
5409 for (; *g1; g1++, count++)
5410 if (round == 2)
5411 clstr[count] = *g1;
5412 if (list_op == CLUSTER_ADD2)
5413 for (; *g2; g2++, count++)
5414 if (round == 2)
5415 clstr[count] = *g2;
5416
5417 if (round == 1)
5418 {
5419 /*
5420 * If the group ended up empty, we don't need to allocate any
5421 * space for it.
5422 */
5423 if (count == 0)
5424 {
5425 clstr = NULL((void*)0);
5426 break;
5427 }
5428 clstr = ALLOC_MULT(short, count + 1)(short *)alloc(sizeof(short) * (count + 1));
5429 if (clstr == NULL((void*)0))
5430 break;
5431 clstr[count] = 0;
5432 }
5433 }
5434
5435 /*
5436 * Finally, put the new list in place.
5437 */
5438 vim_free(*clstr1);
5439 vim_free(*clstr2);
5440 *clstr1 = clstr;
5441}

5443/*
5444 * Lookup a syntax cluster name and return its ID.
5445 * If it is not found, 0 is returned.
5446 */
5447 static int
5448syn_scl_name2id(char_u *name)
5449{
5450 int i;
5451 char_u *name_u;
5452
5453 // Avoid using stricmp() too much, it's slow on some systems
5454 name_u = vim_strsave_up(name);
5455 if (name_u == NULL((void*)0))
5456 return 0;
5457 for (i = curwin->w_s->b_syn_clusters.ga_len; --i >= 0; )
5458 if (SYN_CLSTR(curwin->w_s)((syn_cluster_T *)((curwin->w_s)->b_syn_clusters.ga_data
))[i].scl_name_u != NULL((void*)0)
5459 && STRCMP(name_u, SYN_CLSTR(curwin->w_s)[i].scl_name_u)strcmp((char *)(name_u), (char *)(((syn_cluster_T *)((curwin->
w_s)->b_syn_clusters.ga_data))[i].scl_name_u)) == 0)
5460 break;
5461 vim_free(name_u);
5462 return (i < 0 ? 0 : i + SYNID_CLUSTER23000);
5463}

5483/*
5484 * Find syntax cluster name in the table and return its ID.
5485 * The argument is a pointer to the name and the length of the name.
5486 * If it doesn't exist yet, a new entry is created.
5487 * Return 0 for failure.
5488 */
5489 static int
5490syn_check_cluster(char_u *pp, int len)
5491{
5492 int id;
5493 char_u *name;
5494
5495 name = vim_strnsave(pp, len);
5496 if (name == NULL((void*)0))
5497 return 0;
5498
5499 id = syn_scl_name2id(name);
5500 if (id == 0) // doesn't exist yet
5501 id = syn_add_cluster(name);
5502 else
5503 vim_free(name);
5504 return id;
5505}
5506
5507/*
5508 * Add new syntax cluster and return its ID.
5509 * "name" must be an allocated string, it will be consumed.
5510 * Return 0 for failure.
5511 */
5512 static int
5513syn_add_cluster(char_u *name)
5514{
5515 int len;
5516
5517 /*
5518 * First call for this growarray: init growing array.
5519 */
5520 if (curwin->w_s->b_syn_clusters.ga_data == NULL((void*)0))
5521 {
5522 curwin->w_s->b_syn_clusters.ga_itemsize = sizeof(syn_cluster_T);
5523 curwin->w_s->b_syn_clusters.ga_growsize = 10;
5524 }
5525
5526 len = curwin->w_s->b_syn_clusters.ga_len;
5527 if (len >= MAX_CLUSTER_ID(32767 - 23000))
5528 {
5529 emsg(_("E848: Too many syntax clusters")dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)("E848: Too many syntax clusters"
), 5));
5530 vim_free(name);
5531 return 0;
5532 }
5533
5534 /*
5535 * Make room for at least one other cluster entry.
5536 */
5537 if (ga_grow(&curwin->w_s->b_syn_clusters, 1) == FAIL0)
5538 {
5539 vim_free(name);
5540 return 0;
5541 }
5542
5543 CLEAR_POINTER(&(SYN_CLSTR(curwin->w_s)[len]))memset(((&(((syn_cluster_T *)((curwin->w_s)->b_syn_clusters
.ga_data))[len]))), (0), (sizeof(*(&(((syn_cluster_T *)((
curwin->w_s)->b_syn_clusters.ga_data))[len])))));
5544 SYN_CLSTR(curwin->w_s)((syn_cluster_T *)((curwin->w_s)->b_syn_clusters.ga_data
))[len].scl_name = name;
5545 SYN_CLSTR(curwin->w_s)((syn_cluster_T *)((curwin->w_s)->b_syn_clusters.ga_data
))[len].scl_name_u = vim_strsave_up(name);
5546 SYN_CLSTR(curwin->w_s)((syn_cluster_T *)((curwin->w_s)->b_syn_clusters.ga_data
))[len].scl_list = NULL((void*)0);
5547 ++curwin->w_s->b_syn_clusters.ga_len;
5548
5549 if (STRICMP(name, "Spell")strcasecmp((char *)(name), (char *)("Spell")) == 0)
5550 curwin->w_s->b_spell_cluster_id = len + SYNID_CLUSTER23000;
5551 if (STRICMP(name, "NoSpell")strcasecmp((char *)(name), (char *)("NoSpell")) == 0)
5552 curwin->w_s->b_nospell_cluster_id = len + SYNID_CLUSTER23000;
5553
5554 return len + SYNID_CLUSTER23000;
5555}

5557/*
5558 * Handle ":syntax cluster {cluster-name} [contains={groupname},..]
5559 * [add={groupname},..] [remove={groupname},..]".
5560 */
5561 static void
5562syn_cmd_cluster(exarg_T *eap, int syncing UNUSED__attribute__((unused)))
5563{
5564 char_u *arg = eap->arg;
5565 char_u *group_name_end;
5566 char_u *rest;
5567 int scl_id;
5568 short *clstr_list;
5569 int got_clstr = FALSE0;
5570 int opt_len;
5571 int list_op;
5572
5573 eap->nextcmd = find_nextcmd(arg);
5574 if (eap->skip)
5575 return;
5576
5577 rest = get_group_name(arg, &group_name_end);
5578
5579 if (rest != NULL((void*)0))
5580 {
5581 scl_id = syn_check_cluster(arg, (int)(group_name_end - arg));
5582 if (scl_id == 0)
5583 return;
5584 scl_id -= SYNID_CLUSTER23000;
5585
5586 for (;;)
5587 {
5588 if (STRNICMP(rest, "add", 3)strncasecmp((char *)(rest), (char *)("add"), (size_t)(3)) == 0
5589 && (VIM_ISWHITE(rest[3])((rest[3]) == ' ' || (rest[3]) == '\t') || rest[3] == '='))
5590 {
5591 opt_len = 3;
5592 list_op = CLUSTER_ADD2;
5593 }
5594 else if (STRNICMP(rest, "remove", 6)strncasecmp((char *)(rest), (char *)("remove"), (size_t)(6)) == 0
5595 && (VIM_ISWHITE(rest[6])((rest[6]) == ' ' || (rest[6]) == '\t') || rest[6] == '='))
5596 {
5597 opt_len = 6;
5598 list_op = CLUSTER_SUBTRACT3;
5599 }
5600 else if (STRNICMP(rest, "contains", 8)strncasecmp((char *)(rest), (char *)("contains"), (size_t)(8)
) == 0
5601 && (VIM_ISWHITE(rest[8])((rest[8]) == ' ' || (rest[8]) == '\t') || rest[8] == '='))
5602 {
5603 opt_len = 8;
5604 list_op = CLUSTER_REPLACE1;
5605 }
5606 else
5607 break;
5608
5609 clstr_list = NULL((void*)0);
5610 if (get_id_list(&rest, opt_len, &clstr_list, eap->skip) == FAIL0)
5611 {
5612 semsg(_(e_invarg2)dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)(e_invarg2), 5), rest);
5613 break;
5614 }
5615 if (scl_id >= 0)
5616 syn_combine_list(&SYN_CLSTR(curwin->w_s)((syn_cluster_T *)((curwin->w_s)->b_syn_clusters.ga_data
))[scl_id].scl_list,
5617 &clstr_list, list_op);
5618 else
5619 vim_free(clstr_list);
5620 got_clstr = TRUE1;
5621 }
5622
5623 if (got_clstr)
5624 {
5625 redraw_curbuf_later(SOME_VALID35);
5626 syn_stack_free_all(curwin->w_s); // Need to recompute all.
5627 }
5628 }
5629
5630 if (!got_clstr)
5631 emsg(_("E400: No cluster specified")dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)("E400: No cluster specified")
, 5));
5632 if (rest == NULL((void*)0) || !ends_excmd2(eap->cmd, rest))
5633 semsg(_(e_invarg2)dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)(e_invarg2), 5), arg);
5634}

5636/*
5637 * On first call for current buffer: Init growing array.
5638 */
5639 static void
5640init_syn_patterns(void)
5641{
5642 curwin->w_s->b_syn_patterns.ga_itemsize = sizeof(synpat_T);
5643 curwin->w_s->b_syn_patterns.ga_growsize = 10;
